Reviews.Title: “I loved my month here”
Reviews.Author: wantingbetterservice
Reviews.Content: I was in Seattle on business for a month. Kimpton offers a long-term rate via the web site, and I took advantage of it. The rooms here are great. The furniture is nice, the desk is good-sized and the Internet is of good quality. I was happy with the bed and bedding. The Library has a great breakfast and wonderful waitstaff. The doormen are friendly and helpful. Food at the bar was also great - the cheesy fries were awesome! My only true beef was with the exercise room - the hotel advertises jump ropes and hula hoops, but it would be dangerous to try either activity in the exercise room which is small, small, small. I wound up running the stairs when the weather was inclement. The location of the Hotel Alexis is wonderful. It is close to the water and also Pioneer Square. There is a Japanese place on the same block that offers discounts to hotel guests. I do prefer both the Monaco and the Vintage Park over the Alexis.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: RJTB
Reviews.Content: The Alexis is a Kimpton Hotel, which is a wonderful group of hotels. The decor is quite beautiful and every person on the staff is warm and friendly and most important, very helpful. They welcome pets, offering dogsitting and dogwalking services. I especially love the elegant coffee and tea service offered every morning in the lobby as well as the wine hour every afternoon. Once you join Kimpton InTouch, wifi is free in your room as well as the lobby. The hotel locations are usually excellent and I would go out of my way to stay in a Kimpton.

Reviews.Title: “To stay somewhere else in Seattle would be deemed gross negligence by a court of law!”
Reviews.Author: EAC6
Reviews.Content: I could list off a string of superlatives that would fill the page so I'll instead opt to be a bit more concise. Simply put, this is the best hotel in Seattle that is run by people that truly do put Seattle's best foot forward. Helpful, welcoming, warm and friendly. I'm not a celebrity and not important to anyone other than my dog, but staying here made me feel like I was a VIP at every turn. The staff was a fantastic group and it comes from the top down - epitomized by the general manager who truly is one of the great ones and totally gets what hospitality and care are all about. I'm a huge fan the place and those who work there. Do yourself a favor, stay here... and then book an extra night because you won't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: baltimorebeachbum
Reviews.Content: While we enjoyed our stay at Alexis, I preferred Monaco. The Alexis room was very small and had a strange smell. It's a nice hotel and I would stay again, but given the coice, I would go back to Hotel Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Simply outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: srheller
Reviews.Content: Excellent location.....such attention to detail! We had a "fire" experience.....not a big deal..but the way they handled it all? ...and the special "perk' for taking good care of us during the evacuation.....??( Lasted just minutes...early evening..). Love staying in a hotel that absolutely caters to its guests...even in the craziest circumstances..Thank you for a fabulous time...staff was amazing! Right in the middle of Seattle. ...a short jaunt to the Market...and the shops!!!!.SO fun!

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: mac1504
Reviews.Content: staff was very helpful and kind. quality was average. could stand some renovation. upgraded to king size bed which was nice. bath tub is old style. significant street noise.

Reviews.Title: “A thoughtful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: CptTim
Reviews.Content: When I made the reservetions I did tell them that we were celebrating an anniversary when she asked. But it was such a lovely surprise that the incredably friendly front desk staff had champagne and chocolaye coveted strawberries waiting in our room. Beautiful view of the Sound from our 6 floor room. Cute animal print robes. We actually got better price direct from hotel than even kayak since we got $20 off w AAA card. Free wii fi if you sign up for free Kimpton rewards cards and few other perks. Free wine/ cheese hr! Very satisfied w service!!

Reviews.Title: “Alexis with teens”
Reviews.Author: Marcia021
Reviews.Content: I'm on my last day of a four night stay at the hotel and I would definitely come and stay again, especially traveling with teens who want their own space. I booked a queen/queen and asked for a larger room and was given a large suite with a separate tv room, which my girls loved. The staff were delightful and you get the sense that they really care. The little things matter and the staff here seem to get that hands down. After our first night I asked if we might move to a higher floor as I found the rumbling noise of traffic from the street was annoying and waking me up and was immediately offered a room on the highest floor. As it was a smaller room my daughters begged me not to move so we stayed put and I opted for earplugs instead. If you are a light sleeper you will be happier away from the road noise! Having said that it's the little things that matter, here are my suggestions for management that would elevate the guest experience to an even higher level and would have moved my overall rating to excellent 1. Long distance charges are way too high! Provide calls within North America free. 2. Please put a small bar of soap in the bathroom for hand washing. 3. Ditch the hard, scratchy dark robes for new plush and soft white or white background animal print (I envision white leopard print). No one really wants to wear a scratchy dark robe and it is better not to have them than go part of the way! I was very very happy with the customer service!!! Excellent job right from front desk to housekeeping! 3.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jgg017
Reviews.Content: We arrived by train, which was a short walk through Pioneer Square to the hotel. The staff greeting us were very friendly. We booked the steam room and it was amazing. Private, relaxing - just what the doctor ordered. Unfortunately, we don't drink so we couldn't take advantage of the evening wine tasting in the lobby, but it looked very inviting. The bed was huge and very comfortable. I would recomment this hotel to any visitor to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay, not amazing either”
Reviews.Author: rstorr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alexis on business for a week. The staff were friendly up on check in and helpful in suggesting places to eat, as it was late evening on a Saturday. The room was a decent size with a comfy arm hair and desk hair and they provide you with some funky dressing leopard print dressing gowns. There were no main lights in the room and only lamps which did not have a central switch so had to stumble around in the dark for a few mins to find this out. The room was fairly clean. But if you wanted to be picky, there was a lot of dust behind the bathroom mirror which could easily have been cleaned. Bathroom was a good size with a big shower, but a bit more water pressure would have been good. It wasn't a trickle but isn't wasn't powerful either which was disappointing as they had large shower rain style shower heads. The "fitness room" was a tiny room with 1 treadmill, 1 x-trainer, 1 bike and a few light weights but with no weight bench, so had to improvise using an an crunch bench. Not the best. Location was OK, a couple of blocks from Pike Place Market and a few more to Westlake Centre. 2 blocks from the transit tunnel, either up a steep hill or walk a block more to Pioneer Sq along the level. They offer a hosted wine evening hour but I was not informed of the time and only found out by chance it was timed for late afternoon/early evening. Not the best for someone on business as you'd probably still be working. Overall, not a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dani11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed the Alexis multiple times for work and personal travel. I am a huge fan-the rooms are really nice and spacious. The staff is fantastic and I have always had great service. The hosted wine hour is nice and they provide yoga mats and other extras upon request. The location is great-right in downtown Seattle. The fitness room isn't great, but I read that they are upgrading it. The Alexis is my go-to recommendation for friends heading to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Kimpton Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: LibbyTeal
Reviews.Content: The Alexis is a perfect home-away-from-home in Seattle. A beautiful boutique hotel, with a good restaurant and separate bar attached. Our room was lovely and comfortable, and we were well treated by all the staff. It's also a great location, just a few blocks walk from Pike Place Market, SAM, Pioneer Square, and the Seattle Public Library. Eating and shopping options abound, and there's easy access to public transportation. My only complaint is that the spa services offered are misleading. On the website, and in the little book in your hotel room, they list a variety of massages, facials and other in-room spa treatments. However, when I called the number to schedule an appointment, I was told that the person who provided those services was out of town indefinitely, so all that was available was a basic massage. Not at all what was advertised!

Reviews.Title: “Short and Sweet”
Reviews.Author: PaulYakima
Reviews.Content: arguably the best hotel in Seattle: boutique without being fake, caring without inauthenticity, rooms first rate, and most important the staff is simply genuine and committed. I left a computer bag, was called within an hour, and the staff boxed it and sent it to me the next day. Competent and wonderful. The Bistro is a community, the staff also excellent. Simply--stay there.

Reviews.Title: “"We Will Be Back!"”
Reviews.Author: Brittney W
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend is in the army and currently serving overseas in Afghanistan. On his R&R (15 day trip home half-way through deployment) we stayed at the Alexis Hotel in Seattle. We were quickly greeted with valet parking and a wonderful friendly staff who informed us of everything around our hotel and even gave us a map and told us where the Space Needle was located and much more places that we planned to see while on our stay. We had our luggage unpacked for us, they hung up all our jackets and were more than pleased to get us anything we wanted. The room was amazing and we were upgraded for free upon arrival. On our last night the hotel sent up a romance package with chocolate covered strawberries, sparkling cider (noted that we don't drink) and a personalized message from the front desk lady wishing us the best of luck on our journey. My boyfriend was given the bext of treatment by everyone at the hotel and felt so supported for what he is doing for our country. WE WILL BE BACK! We visit Seattle as often as possible when he comes home and we will be staying at the Alexis everytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: home4life
Reviews.Content: Old style hotel close to the ferry terminal and very charming. Great rooms and wonderful bar for visiting with old friends. Restaurant for breakfast was a little slow on service, but food was as good as it gets for breakfast. Definitely the place I'll stay when I return next month!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service and Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ackz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Alexis four or five times when in Seattle on business, and I doubt that I will ever stay anywhere else. The good experience begins with check in, with the always friendly front desk staff. The rooms are a comfortable size and decorated in a cool blend of contemporary and funky-traditional styles, in restful blues and beiges. My room in the north tower had a view of the water, making the time spent working before my meeting very enjoyable. As a Kimpton Insider, I enjoy free internet, something that many hotels fail to provide. There is also a $10 credit for the mini-bar; I always take a chocolate bar home for my daughter. Insiders also get an option to upgrade for a fraction of the room differential on an availability basis; on this trip I had reserved a queen room and got a king for an additional $11. I booked my 70-something parents at The Alexis when they spent a long weekend in Seattle last fall. My dad developed an ache in his neck on the long flight from Michigan; the hotel staff found a heating pad for him and remembered to ask if he was feeling better throughout their stay. The only real negatives are a very small fitness room and a somewhat limited room service menu. Don't miss this hotel on your next trip to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: T W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending an exhibition at Seattle Art Museum (3 blocks away). Pleasant, charming boutique hotel. Small enough for the staff to be very friendly & genuinely interested in our needs. Spacious & comfortable room. We reserved the steam room for an hour--total decadence. Breakfast in the Library Bistro was very good. The food at happy hour in the cozy Bookstore Bar was so good we kept ordering and cancelled our formal dinner plans. We were looking for a special get-away without breaking the bank--the Alexis exceeded our expectations. We'd definitely go back,

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Subkid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I set out for a night out in the big city. We usually stay at the Vintage Park (another Kimpton Hotel) however we had received an email inviting us to The Alexis. Upon arriving at the hotel we were greeted by a very friendly front desk. They recognized that it was our first time staying at the Alexis. Upon hearing that we usually stay at the Vintage Park, they teasingly responded with "Oh we are definitely going to steal you away." To which, we were immediately upgraded to the "Northwest Ballet Suite"; I'd say that's a good start. This room was amazing!! Upon opening the door, you are greeted with this long entry way; far away from the hall. The entry way, as well as the entire room is adorned with beautiful pictures of the Northwest Ballet's incredible dancers. There was a separate bedroom with a huge picture window enveloped by an arched window frame with a rope light nestled inside, casting just the right amount of ambience down onto the sheer curtains and creating the perfect romantic atmosphere. There was another hallway connecting the entry way to the dining and living area surrounded by a wall of windows. The room was on the corner of the building and there was an awesome view of Elliot Bay from anywhere in the room. This room was bigger than some studio apartments. We were really impressed. We had dinner at the Elephant & Castle on 5th Avenue. They have the best Grilled Salmon with this cider glaze baked on. We pretty much eat there everytime we come to the city. Later that night we came back to the hotel and had drinks at the Library Bistro. I have to say that The Alexis is in a great location for shopping and dining. The next day we walked up to Westlake Center and did some shopping. It was a wonderful weekend and we would love to do it again sometime soon. Who knows; maybe we'll be seeing The Alexis again sooner than we thought......sorry Vintage Park.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest staff of any hotel ever!!!! Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Joni R
Reviews.Content: The Alexis' staff is the friendliest of any hotel I've ever been to. They are perfect and not just to get a tip either. The hotel is clean and quiet and a perfect place to stay near the Market and waterfront. Parking is extra but totally secure so you can leave anything in your car. Beds are comfortable and spotlessly clean. This is our Seattle hotel... it is worth the big price for security, quiet and location. The room decor is a bit odd.... sort of over done... but they think of everything to make your stay pleasant and hassle-free.

Reviews.Title: “Just the best”
Reviews.Author: John177
Reviews.Content: We love Kimptons. Alexis is even better than the norm. Staff is terrific. Super friendly, way helpful from the minute we pulled the car up through getting supper recommendations. I forgot a razor; they didn't have one at the front desk and so ran out and got one for me. Where else would that happen? Location - great. Short walk up the hill for work, a few blocks to Pike Place in one direction, Pioneer Square in the other, and easy access to a terrific running route along Elliott Bay. Hotel - beautiful. Public spaces are filled with interesting art, as was our room/suite (upgraded through Kimpton InTouch). High ceilings, full living room, luxurious. Shampoo and soaps are in big squeeze containers instead of those ridiculous little plastic bottles that end up in landfill. Restaurants - the Bookstore bar is fun, great drinks, so-so food. The Library for breakfast is better. We liked Fado, an Irish bar, and Cafe Bengodi, a tiny Italian place, just a couple blocks down First. The wine at the afternoon reception was really good. I guess you could spend more money at the usual chains, or lots more down the street at the Four Seasons. But why?

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed with Kimpton Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Leewinfield
Reviews.Content: Great hotel nothing could be better. Excellent staff and the restaurant was top notch

Reviews.Title: “Georgeous rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mag R
Reviews.Content: We had just an overnight stay in the North tower that faced the back alley. The room opened out to a small patio that was shared with the room next door. Even though our room was one of the smaller ones in this tower it was already bigger than any typical standard sized modern hotel room. A full sized sofa, club chair, coffee table made up the sitting area. Other furniture and fixtures tastefully decorated the room. The georgeous part for us were the approximately 15 foot ceilings and 12 foot windows - old style elegance. However, the art work dotted around the room (table lamps, standing vases, wall pictures, etc.) were modern style and balanced the old style elegance nicely. Staff are very friendly - from the valet, room attendants, reception, and bar. We were made to feel at home from the moment we said hi. This hotel is a short walk to many of Seattle's attractions, e.g. Seattle Art Museum, Seattle Symphony's Benaroya Hall, Pike Street Market, Pioneer Square, Pacific Centre. We'll be back to stay the next chance we get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Patsy H
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel,I went to a birthday party and staff was professional. Love the room it was very clean and lot space.

Reviews.Title: “My New Fav Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bifocalpear
Reviews.Content: It was my first stay at the Alexis, but it won't be my last! My room was spacious; in fact my college student niece said it was larger than some apartments in Seattle. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Comfortable, convenient, spotless and tidy! Lots of light with huge windows, heavenly bed and seating. Excellent food in the adjoining Library Bistro. Try their Dutch Baby for breakfast! I just liked the vibe of the place. Like I was home but better! :)

Reviews.Title: “Now That's What I Call A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheChadi
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on my visit to Seattle in January and could have not been more surprised. The rooms are very clean, spacious (don't know how people complain about space, even by American standards that's spacious let alone European tin can sized rooms), the location was just excellent and the hotel staff could not have been nicer. Located on First Avenue, a short walk from Pikes Place Market and even shorter walk to Pier 50 to take ferries across to West Seattle. Plenty of nice restaurants and good restaurants around with some of best night clubs in town a short walk away. The rooms were spacious, clean, modern and the bed was very comfortable. The Internet was fast and complementary for being a Kimpton InTouch member and even received a $10 minibar voucher as a gift for being a member. The only reason I signed up for the membership before arriving there was to get the free Internet but then started to see the benefits of being a member. The staff could not have been any nicer anywhere I have visited in the world. They were genuinely happy and very glad to help and assist with any requests. I was always addressed by my name which showed the attention to detail they had. Employees in the Westin (anywhere on earth) would never be smiling as much as the employees at this fine hotel while maintaining full professionalism. After my stay, I received a letter from the management of the Alexis asking how everything went and the correspondence was both very professional and personalized. It felt like I was in touch with a human being who is very service minded and who genuinely cared. Unlike staying with other chains that unfortunately treats everyone just like another business transaction. I booked yet another Kimpton hotel in San Francisco based on my impression by this one and was also pleasantly surprised. On my return to Seattle in February, I stayed at the Alexis again and I can not be happier for making that decision. Looking forward for my next stay at the Alexis next time I am in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: mbb500
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 30+ tmes over the past 9 years. Attentive, professional staff, great rooms & perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “great location with small but comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: sjdif
Reviews.Content: location is great. Beds are comfortable but rooms are small. On site restaurant good quality and reasonable priced menu.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandAndrea
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, great rooms. Can't wait to get back!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: cavafan
Reviews.Content: I can only reiterate what others have said. A wonderful small hotel, located just blocks from Pike Market. Very reasonable rates, especially given that I was upgraded to a huge suite with dining area and sitting room. The bar/cafe downstairs has excellent food, and a great beer and whiskey selection. Free newspapers, nice decor, professional staff. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty sweet.”
Reviews.Author: duckdevil
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alexis a few years ago and had forgotten why I liked it so much. Here is what they do quite well: - Spacious and tastefully luxurious rooms; my suite has a super-sweet home theater area and wet bar. - Well-trained, friendly and professional staff. - Great location - if you like the Pike Street Market area downtown. There are tons of restaurants and interesting stores surrounding the hotel. - Nice amenities, including good food; A steam room, wine gatherings, gorgeous artwork; I was initially disappointed to see a very limited room service dinner menu, but the restaurant has decided to really nail those limited offerings. It's bistro food, so don't expect complicated fare. Excellent fish and chips - light breading, fresh fish, homemade tartar sauce. Here is what could improve: The beer selection. Respectfully, Mr. or Ms. Food and Beverage Mgr., this is the Pacific NW. There is no excuse for not having a fuller, well-balanced beer offering. I do have to give props to the room service woman who, hearing the dissapointment in my voice on the phone at having to settle for an IPA (I'm not an IPA guy, but it was the only legitimate craft beer they had) miraculously showed up with a black IPA she somehow scrounged up. Good initiative!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KrystaLynnette
Reviews.Content: I just got home from the best mini vacation I've ever had. My stay at the Alexis was fabulous. The hotel is beautifully decorated, clean and relaxing. The service was professional and everyone greeted us with a smile and warm welcome. I was blown away with our suite, nothing but smiles on my face as I took it all in. The location is perfect for anything you would like to do in downtown. We walked to Pikes, Pioneer Square, and even the waterfront without any time or distance issues and when we needed our car, it was brought up to us within minutes of our asking. I will definitely recommend The Alexis to anyone I know who is looking for somewhere to stay in Seattle! Thank you to the friendly staff who made this weekend so perfect!

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parrys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a layover in Seattle on a trip back home to BC. We got a good last minute deal to stay at the Alexis in the downtown area. It is a super boutique hotel. Lovely decour, smallish but very well layed out rooms. Luxurious linens and bath products. Excellent staff. Great morning coffee and papers. Super location and a really nice bistro/pub right by the lobby with a great happy hour. (We had appetizers and two drinks each for 40 dollars). Only drawback was the late night revellers downtown who staggered by very early in the morning. A word of caution, the parking is very costly ( I believe 36/night) - although we didn't have our car. Also, I think the rates start to climb up as the cruise season approachs. WE will certainly make another trip to Seattle and to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: monkeyFUZ
Reviews.Content: The Alexis is the best. The service is always great the location is awesome. I would recommend the Alexis to anyone going to visit Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Hip”
Reviews.Author: LBH1555
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a cycling trip in the San Juan Islands and wanted to have a night in Seattle before we returned home. Loved the Decor, loved the resturant and the bar, service was exceptional. Great location for walking almost everywhere. Exactly what we were looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Hotels are the best!”
Reviews.Author: C B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Alexis in Seattle for a quick gettaway weekend.. The service was wonderful and the location was even better. What a perfect place to stay in the city. We would definitely recommend the Alexis to our friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: HaidaLisa
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took the Amtrak Cascades train from Vancouver, Canada to Seattle, Washington at the beginning of January. We needed to book a room for one night before leaving for Sea Tac Airport. While researching (on the train) I discovered the Alexis had a special room rate for people arriving on the train. I booked the hotel and upon arriving in Seattle found that the taxi ride was brief (and thus inexpensive) from the train station to the hotel. Before we had barely stepped out of the taxi, the doorman was there to offer his assistance. Upon checking in with a very friendly woman staffing the front desk, we admired all of the one of a kind art lining the halls to the elevator. We got to our room and I almost called down to the front desk to say that we had been given the wrong room. The lovely woman at the front desk had upgraded us to what had to have been one of the largest hotel rooms that I have ever stayed in. We walked down the entrance hall and the bathroom was on our right. It was a nice size and bright. The best part was that the toiletries were large scale so as to be more eco-friendly and not the smaller plastic bottles that are replaced with every guest. At the end of the hall was the main room and there was a very large round dining table with a large wall mirror behind it and a comfortable chair tucked into the corner. On the long sideboard was the most extensive array of snack food etc for purchase. Beyond this area was the four poster bed with throw pillows in abundance. The wall beyond the bed was floor to ceiling windows that looked out onto a red-brick office building so thus very quiet in the evening. The area at the foot of the bed was a sitting area. There was a large overstuffed chair, sofa, coffee table, flat screen t.v. and then a patio door. The patio was square and large with yet more seating. As we hadn't had dinner, we pried ourselves from the room and went back downstairs. The front desk woman took the time to make some great suggestions and we ended up around the corner at The Owl. The next day we walked up to Pike Place Market which was only about 3 or 4 blocks away with our loaned hotel umrella. Upon our checkout, the doorman called us a town car and made sure to update us as to its expected arrival. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. The staff, the accommodations and convenience of the area with its delightful shops are all worth returning to. I travel extensively and this was a highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hospitality! Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: KimVancouver
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend getaway at The Alexis and it was flawless. No charge for my dog, a bowl of bones waiting for her as we checked in, a glass of wine for me, and the most spacious, comfortable room you can imagine. Join their Kimpton Club because they send out specials that are crazy amazing. EVERYTHING is walkable from here and the water is just two blocks away. Pictures online don't do it justice ... the place is uber cool and the library bar is so delicious and has such a great vibe you'll just want to hang there.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Christmas in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: wendy h
Reviews.Content: We took our family of five adult couples (no kids) to stay at the Alexis over Christmas and had a wonderful experience. The hotel was lovely in its own right, and the holiday decorations were beautiful - and fun. We rented one executive suite to give us a gathering place and it was perfect. The hotel restaurant was excellent, the staff was really friendly and very very helpful. The location was terrific - lots of things to do and see within an easy walk, including Pike Street Market, the Seattle Art Museum, football (and baseball), loads of restaurants and much more. The prices were very reasonable, especially if you are a Kimpton in Touch member. I recommend it very highly based on our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service and beautiful room!”
Reviews.Author: Xcited4Sunshine
Reviews.Content: The husband booked this hotel for us on our wedding night. We arrived late and the staff was friendly and helpful. They showed us up to our suite right away. Once we got inside, we found a welcome basket with chocolates and champagne. We also arranged for a late check out which the front desk was quick and courteous in granting. We were hungry (since we did not get a chance to actually eat much at our wedding) and ordered a grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup, and something else (so mad I can't remember what it was) from room service. While our food arrived fairly quickly, the soup was cold and honestly, the food was the only real blip in our stay. It just didn't come close to the kind of quality that I'd hope from such a glamorous property. I'd avoid the room service if you could. After a wonderful dip in the tub, and a fabulous night of sleep, we had a late breakfast in the Library Restaurant. OH MY GOODNESS. It was so good. I had french toast, the hubby had crab benedit, and we both ended up sharing because we loved both plates. We also got a complimentary mimosa to celebrate our marriage. Honestly, other than the late night snack not being up to par, every single other aspect of our stay was perfect, from check in to check out. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “The staff make you feel welcom”
Reviews.Author: Robin N
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at the Alexis and brought our dog. All the staff were friendly and accomadating. They welcome pets and they is a big plus for people like us who travel with our dog. Our room was inviting and clean, lots of space and a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: BLGAW
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding and all of the out of town wedding guests stayed here. This is a very nice hotel. Location is very good, too. Decor is beautiful and the staff is very friendly. Beds were very comfortable. However, we found the lack of counterspace in the bathroom to be irritating. Since each room is supposed to have it's own "theme" and decor, perhaps not all rooms had this issue. Many of the guests we spoke with also mentioned the lack of counterspace. If we visited Seattle again, we might stay at The Alexis Hotel again, but we would request a room with counterspace in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service for our wedding”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany C
Reviews.Content: We got married in Seattle in December 2011 and all of our out-of-town guests stayed at the Alexis. We also held our rehearsal dinner there. The hotel provided excellent customer service to us and all of our guests - they made sure that our parents and bridal party had great rooms, the servers at our rehearsal dinner knew our names and were very helpful, and we got numerous comments from our guests about what a great hotel it was. We thought that the catering for the rehearsal dinner was a little overpriced, but it was very convenient for our guests and the hotel threw in free beverages and brought out extra cookies and brownies when we ran short on dessert. The evening wine hour was a hit with our guests too! Overall we could not have been happier and would recommend it to anyone planning an event in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: above10000ft
Reviews.Content: Fits the bill. Great location if you're a tourist, or need to be downtown for work. Super easy access from a airport by Link light-rail for 2.75$, and close to many buses. Right next to water and Pike market. Shopping not far away, restaurants a plenty. Room was quiet, but floor to ceiling windows prevent road traffic sounds from being completely blocked out. Not super huge room (I had a king), but certainly reasonable. Apples, wine and coffee in lobby are a great touch. Service was great. I admit, not paying full price made this hotel made it totally worth it. It's worth full price, but probably could get similar service, amenities and location for a little cheaper at other nearby hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another Kimpton knocks it out of the park!”
Reviews.Author: rednikki
Reviews.Content: A few days before our check-in, we got an email from Ali at the Alexis, asking us if there was anything she could do in advance of our arrival. I figured it was a form letter, but I replied anyway, letting her know I had a package coming and asking if the amazing blue cheese fries were still available at the Library Bar. To my surprise, Ali emailed me back, letting me know that the fries were still available (and delicious) and that she'd keep an eye out for my package. Then I asked if I could give the Kimpton code word (if you don't know about the code word, look for it on their Facebook and Twitter - it leads to many nice surprises), and she said I could and arranged for an upgrade! OMG, our room was fabulous! It was a big suite with an amazingly comfortable couch, a great bedroom and even a dining room table. And on that table was resting a bottle of wine, some absolutely delicious truffles and a card from Ali with a coupon for free blue cheese fries! YUM!!!! The room had a peek view of the bay (I took some photos of the Bainbridge ferry coming in) as well as a nice view of the city. It's in an old building that's been renovated, so the layout has some quirks, but that's part of its charm. The decor had a modern opulence to it; it was the sort of decor I could see myself actually living with. Someone elsewhere said that they don't have free WiFi. That is not entirely correct. So long as you're a member of their frequent stayer program, Kimpton InTouch (which is free), you get free WiFi. We had it and it was both strong and fast. The location of the Alexis is very central and convenient; it's a short walk to both the ferry terminal and the University Metro/Sound Transit bus station. One warning: on weekends every Starbucks, Peet's and other coffee shop within a six block radius is closed, except for the Cherry Bean. Fortunately, the Alexis offers free coffee in the lobby, so all is not lost! The front desk staff is super-knowledgeable about everything both locally and further out. We wound up chatting in the lobby with someone who was looking for wine tasting. We'd just come back from Woodinville, so we had a lot to rave about with regards to wine - but it turns out the gentleman at the front desk knew TONS about the Woodinville wine scene and had lots of insights! The only thing I will note - and I wish now that I had said something while I was there, because I know they would have fixed it - is that the bed in our room was unusually, startlingly firm. I've stayed at other rooms in the Alexis and never had that problem, so I imagine it is a quirk of that particular room. (Probably because some previous occupant felt the bed was not firm enough and the Alexis fixed it for them!) We'll be back in July - and we'll be back at the Alexis again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillingsCouple
Reviews.Content: We wanted to find a nice hotel in downtown to stay while we were in Seattle and found the Alexis online. We had an excellent time in our beautiful room as well as a great view of the Puget Sound from our window. We also asked Jen at the front desk about restaurants in the surrounding area and with her recommendations had a wonderful dinner to cap off the night. We would recommend this hotel to any couple passing through Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool”
Reviews.Author: waltrude
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of positives and only one negative. I'll start with the bad: no free wifi! Instead of free coffee, water, and wine at the lobby, I'd actually prefer to have free wifi. OK, now on to the good things: first, the decor is super chic. The lobby was sleek and the atmosphere was enhanced by the low-key electronic music. The room and bathroom were decorated in a daring way, but with taste. Secondly, the staff was extremely friendly; they give excellent advice about transport, restaurants in the area, etc. On one occasion, I mentioned I had a cold and they sent me a complimentary plate of fruit with mineral water and a get-well note. It was really charming! The location is great, only a block from the waterfront and in the middle of the downtown action.

Reviews.Title: “Great Romantic Evening”
Reviews.Author: Caitlyn J
Reviews.Content: Celebrated an anniversary at the Alexis Hotel. Had a wonderful room with a fireplace so we could stay in and enjoy ourselves!! Jenn who works at the front desk sent us an amazing amenity to help us celebrate our anniversary. I will definitely be recommending Alexis to anyone who will be staying in the Seattle area.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Snorlaxxl
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Argonaut in San Francisco we were looking forward to the Alexis, another Kimpton Hotel. We arrived early and checked bags coming back just after 2 to check in to our room. It would have been nice to have been told which elevators to take as we couldn't find level 6 in the first ones we tried. On being told by housekeeping that there are two elevator wells we finally found our room. We booked a suite and this was very comfortable. The living area was large and the bedroom excellent for Mum and Dad. The bathroom not particularly big and with two people became a bit squeezy. All fixtures and fittings were of high standard and overall we were very comfortable. The hotel is well situated being walking distance to Pike Place and central shopping areas. We enjoyed a drink in the bar downstairs - the scotch whisky collection was impressive and they had some excellent beers on tap. We also breakfasted one morning in the other cafe area and this had excellent food and service. Overall we were impressed with the Alexis and would not hestitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and service-truly enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Theresa T
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at The Alexis Hotel. Their staff provided 5 star customer service and very accomodating. You are warmly welcomed from the moment you walk in the door.You have a multitude of very good restaurants wallking distance away as well as the waterfront, pike place market, and downtown Seattle shopping. I highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cyoung28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December 2011 and loved it! Staff is very friendly and so helpful! Rooms were nice and very clean. My only complaint is that the closet was small but that was pretty minor given all the other great things about the hotel. Location is great and the hotel bar and restaurant were very good and reasonable. Would definitely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST CONCIERGE ON EARTH”
Reviews.Author: LuvSeeingNewCities
Reviews.Content: Not to overshadow the rest of the Alexis staff, but we had the most incredible trip to Seattle because of the Alexis Hotel Concierge, Russell Hathaway. It was New Years Eve and we had never been to Seattle before. He - in so many words - planned out our entire itinerary. He made us multiple dinner reservations and let us choose where to go, laid out options for activities for the day and sent us champagne to our room for our anniversary. He went way above and beyond the call of duty and made our stay one we will never ever forget. Thank you, Russell. In addition to the fabulous concierge, we loved the Alexis. It was walking distance to anything and everything - notably great restaurants and the pier. I would recommend the ferry to Bainbridge Island and the Underground Tour. Both made for fun and exciting days. I would definitely recommend the Alexis. Chic digs, great hotel bar called The Bookstore (we spent a lot of time there, it really is a gem) and kind, wonderful staff. We loved every minute of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Check-in a Huge Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: sweetie7937
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel via the Web in reply to an invitation sent by the Kimpton Group to In Touch subscribers, part of their Suite Sale that included a $25.00 daily dining credit,. We asked for an early check in and sofa sleeper to accommodate our 2 children. We arrived @ about 2:15. We were told right away that our room was not ready and wouldnâ€™t be until about 4PM. Yes, they knew we asked for an early arrival but â€œEveryone checked out really late todayâ€�. We were ok with that, what can you do?. The shocker came after the initial check in when the lady that sort of check us in basically said come back at 4.That was about it, she was done. No mention of the dining credit, we assumed instructions woud be included with our room key later. We are in the reception area, 4 bags, not clear where we even are, its pouring rain and no where to go. Not an offer of a coffee, directions or umbrella. I went to the doorman asked for the concierge, there wasn't one on right now he explained but they could give us a map and directions if we needed. He took us back to the SAME WOMAN that sort of checked us in. She now gave us a quick run down on where the Market and shopping were. They would now keep our bags and send to our suite. I could not understand why she wouldnâ€™t help us in the first place. Out into the rain we went. We arrived back around 4:45. The first lady was gone. We got our room key and headed upstairs. No luggage. We went back down stairs to find it. Front desk will now send up. We never did get the dining credit or instructions, and when we inquired about it we were told the restaurant was closed. We spent our money elsewhere. The room was lovely. The doormen and desk staff other than the original lady were exceptional. Its really too bad that one person can spoil an entire visit. Not the Kimpton experience we know and had expected.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely.”
Reviews.Author: sussexhamster
Reviews.Content: I was staying here overnight before catching the plane back to the UK. Hotel is easy to get to from the Link light rail (though it's a steep old hill walking back up!). This is the second Kimpton hotel I've stayed in and once again I found the warmest of welcomes on arrival. Definitely worth joining the "In Touch" loyalty programme - free wifi, and a voucher for the minibar. I also had a password from the facebook page, which got me a free cocktail as well. On top of this, I got upgraded to a fabulous room, which in all honestly felt more like a suite; four poster king-size bed, huge tv, spotless and well-laid out bathroom. The reception staff couldn't have been more friendly or more helpful, and made me feel right at home within minutes. I've stayed in a lot of hotels and I can't remember a time when I've felt so comfortable so quickly. I had drinks and dinner in the Bookstore Bar. It's a rare treat to find a hotel bar which is obviously genuinely a hang-out for locals too, but this was such a place. The Cosmos were excellent and the pear salad outstanding, and remarkable value. I felt absolutely comfortable in there as a woman travelling alone, and again, that isn't always a given. Bed was ultra-comfortable, and the room was very quiet, so I slept like the proverbial log. Breakfast was lovely, and I'd been so pleased with dinner that I chose to have lunch back at the hotel before heading back to the airport rather than eating somewhere else in town. The location is excellent. As well as being in easy reach of the buses and light railway, you are only minutes from Pike Place market and even closer to the brilliant Seattle Art Museum Also handy for the major department stores. I haven't got enough good things to say about this hotel. If I ever need a hotel in Seattle again I won't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: canadianphil
Reviews.Content: I'm a Kimpton member and have always liked their hotels a lot. I got a great deal on the Alexis and stayed there for 3 nights in December just before Xmas. It's a nice hotel, but there were a lot of little things that were off. First, I found the bed the least comfortable of any Kimpton hotel at which I stayed. I mentioned this to the person on check-out and she said they'd recently replaced their mattresses and gone with somewhat softer, less firm ones so if you need a firmer mattress for your back (as I do), I'd recommend you might want to think twice about this hotel. There were also several little things not quite right with the room (it was cooler than I'd like, I couldn't turn the heat up, there was no extra blanket in the closet, there was a small problem with the shower). Kudos to the staff, who addressed each and every one of these issues promptly and in a very friendly manner, but it's unusual in my experience to run into so many little things. Also, as friendly and polite as the staff was, service was mixed. In the restaurant for breakfast, I sat there for 15 minutes and had to go over and talk to a waitress before I got any service (she did apologize profusely for not seeing me in the booth) and on checkout, it was a full 30 minutes from when I phoned down to the front desk asking for a bellhop and for my car to be pulled out of valet parking until I was actually in my car and driving away. They said there were busy with people checking out (it was about 11:15 am when I called down), but 30 minutes still seems like a lot to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Michaelle C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Seattle for the Saturday Seahawks game before heading up north to our family Christmas. Kaitlyn helped us get checked in after a small issue with our reservation. Definately not the hotels fault. Our friend booked the room for us and put it in his name. Kaitlyn spoke to him and we were in the most beautiful room we have seen. The location couldn't be better. A short walk to the waterfront, Pike's Place Market and both sports stadiums. The Library Bistro staff was very attentative and friendly. Thank you to all who helped make our holiday stay feel as if we were at home with family.

Reviews.Title: “had a blast”
Reviews.Author: culbyramfan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Seattle for a week to site see and watch a football game on Monday night.We chose the Alexis Hotel because of the good reviews and the location seemed pretty good for what we wanted to do and see.It far exceeded all our expectations, the location was absolutley perfect(close to Pike Market and stadiums), the customer service was exceptional and our room was wonderful. If and when we return to Seattle this will know doubt be where we stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Alexis”
Reviews.Author: Crissy T
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Alexis was better than any hotel I have been to in the last 5 years and I have been to a lot. I must have appeared lost because a young man by the name of Mike asked if I needed assistance and I thought, Wow! I didn't realize that people were that friendly in Seattle. I found out later on that he actually works there and was off duty but still very helpful. My room was great! Nice and Clean, The front Staff, the Valet and all peoples I encountered at the Alexis were friendly, sincere and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: DallasLonghorn
Reviews.Content: Was there for 3 days - really liked the hotel. It is nice, has hip rooms and is very clean. Good location in Seattle, friendly staff. Also has cool bar/restaurant attached.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way...”
Reviews.Author: podmomma
Reviews.Content: Booked the Alexis for a night in Seattle- a fabulous choice for the atmosphere, decor and incredibly beautiful and comfortable room. I had mentioned that we were celebrating a romantic early Christmas so the jacuzzi tub in the gorgeously appointed suite was absolutely stunning and such a welcome treat. While getting ready to attend a show at the Paramont Theatre, the room service staff arrived with chocolate dipped strawberries and sparkling wine with a lovey welcome card from the manager- so we felt indulged at every turn. We ventured out for a bit of shopping- and could have spent days exploring the local stores, and it is a great location for a stroll to Pike Place Market and the waterfront- my only regret was having to leave after only one night!! We are already planning to return in January and spend at least two nights to explore more of the area- and the Alexis and its staff will always be our choice for its warm and welcoming atmosphere and service.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great weekend away...”
Reviews.Author: Lisa Z
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a lovely blend of old and new - with up to date stylings in a heritage building. The Bookstore Bar was a really nice spot with a great bartender "Crystal" who was very knowledgable with her Single Malt Scotches and made our experience something to remember. We were very impressed with our room - very sophisticated decor. The front desk staff was very friendly and helped us with where we needed to go. Overall, it was a great getaway - we would totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way”
Reviews.Author: tas10000
Reviews.Content: We spent the night of our 25th Anniversary in this wonderful hotel. We upgraded to a spa suite which was beautifully appointed. The room was very large, tastefully and uniquely decorated. The bathroom included a giant whirlpool bath. At a moderate price we felt we were living in the lap of luxury. The ladies at the front desk were exceptionally friendly and all the service staff was accommodating. I don't have a single negative comment about this fine hotel experience, and without question will reserve a room there on my next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Alexis from December 7-9 2011 and enjoyed everything about it. Large, clean room and friendly, attentive staff. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and spacious”
Reviews.Author: mr_bijae
Reviews.Content: I knew the Alexis Hotel in Seattle would be something to behold, since it is a Kimpton property. However, I was not prepared for the simple elegance of this property. Upon entering you are greeted by several staff that are quick to get you checked in. There is barely enough time to admire the lobby, they are that efficient. I chose to stay in the Fireplace Suite on this trip. I was not disappointed. This suite was huge, offering a full living room and a full sized dining table. The counter bar was enormous. I wished I was staying there for a full week. The jetted tub was perfect after a long drive, and then to curl up around the fireplace and read a book? Well me and my dogs LOVED it.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat.”
Reviews.Author: adamandlisao
Reviews.Content: We loved the service and everything that makes the Alexis an outstanding hotel. We especially loved the concierge John A. He more then once went out of his way to provide us with transportation and even helping us with breakfast in bed. Ty again! We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “don't be put off by the bath robes!”
Reviews.Author: Philip B
Reviews.Content: We had a really good stay at this hotel at the end of November. Very helpful staff with a 'can do' attitude and a welcoming atmosphere. We were very fortunate to be upgraded and I must say we were surprised by the size and facilities of the room, together with (mostly) a view of the water. Probably worth paying for the larger rooms/suite if you can, facing the sound. The hotel is well placed for everything and offers something a little different than the 'formula' hotels. This is an older building, so if you are fussy about hearing people above you walking around on creaky floor boards, this may not be the place for you. We enjoyed our stay. If you enjoy good Italian food with no pretentions, try the basic decor but excellent food of Bencoldi, (Luigi's) just down the road towards the station. Happy hour after 8 whe all food is half price is just amazing.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in downtown Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: shortbusd88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexis for a holiday party downtown and we were very impressed with the welcoming atmosphere, friendly staff, and even other guests in the hotel. The staff made us feel as though we were the only.ones staying at the hotel. They had a complimentary wine.hour that was incredible and we made quick friends with people staying at the hotel. The room was perfect and the bed very comfortable. I would recommend this place to anyone staying or visiting downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: fcadavid
Reviews.Content: I basically live in hotels, and this has been one of my favorites in Seattle. I didn't give it a full five star rating because the hotel does lack a good restaurant, but otherwise, it's even better than expected!!! Enjoy it... it makes your Seattle experience even more spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating accommodations”
Reviews.Author: TryItAll76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel internationally a lot and we were flying in from Beijing to Seattle and wanted a place to get over jet lag and relax, with lots of stuff to do around us. We found the perfect place in the Alexis. Centrally located to great shopping, restaurants and the pier the Alexis was very comfortable. We stayed in the Symphony Suite which was very large and comfy. The desk clerks were very helpful and concierge recommended great seafood joints. I would make a vacation based around this hotel if we go to Seattle again. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: 123sorjul
Reviews.Content: I was happy with our stay at hotel as well the choice we made to stay here for our getaway weekend. Do not travel a lot but this was perfect experience for me and my family. Hotel is in central location to all the places we planed to visit, staff could not be more acomodating and friendly. Enjoyed complimentary wine hour and the small bites offered with it. Room was large with modern but comfortable feel. Looking faward to our next stay, I hope sooner then later.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Catherine K
Reviews.Content: Yes, there's lot's of great reviews-however-when you arrive at 10:30PM-that truly demonstrates a good property and I was mega impressed. Not only did they have a nice room, they had a double complimentary upgrade-what? I had to ask-really-that's true? I was welcomed and treated like a special guest for the entire experience. The room was very very spacious, w/beautiful artwork, large screen TV, very large sitting & office area, and a bath that belongs in a great spa. My room also had a sea view of Puget Sound! They valet parked the car, provided the upgrades, and even discounted the bill by a few $ as I joined 'Klimpton' program prior to my arrival. I'm a member of other hotel rewards program-but this far exceeds expectations! Great job management of Seattle Alexis. You've now set the bar higher for your competitors. I'll definitely be back :)

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gina M
Reviews.Content: I was having my family in town from out of state and thought The Alexis would be the perfect place for all of us to stay over the holiday weekend, wow, was I right! Our experience, from start to finish, was top notch! The service is excellent, very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were beautiful and so clean... very well equipped with lovely fresh sheets, fully stocked kitchen and even two cozy robes(in addition too all of the "regular" amenities)! We would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone who's looking for an upscale stay right in downtown Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place”
Reviews.Author: Adam C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for our anniversary and we had an amazing time. It was close to some very nice restaurants, and the one in the hotel was wonderful. We ate breakfast there the next morning. Definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: J_L_Edmonton2010
Reviews.Content: The Alexis is one of those 100 year old buildings in downtown Seattle that has been reborn to become a very beautiful modern hotel. Tastefully decorated and expertly staffed, the Alexis was a wonderful stay. During the stormy November of this year it was a pleasure to retreat to our cozy room after a day of sightseeing. The staff readily dealt with any requests with a smile and were eager to help us with any questions about the sights of Seattle. The complimentary wine tasting evenings were a treat in that it gave us a chance to get to know fellow guests and to compare notes on daily adventures. An added treat was the private steam room that you book at the front desk, a great end to a chilly day! The location of this hotel could not have been better; within a short walking distance of the waterfront, Pike Market, and the lightrail and transit system. We would definitely stay at the Alexis again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, good location, good staff, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: crimson999
Reviews.Content: Downtown Hotels are often tricky. Got a good rate online so risked the Alexis. Firstly, it's in a good position downtown, just a short stroll from Pike Place. i found the staff very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small (downtown rooms often are) but stylish. the Alexis is kind of a boutique style. I had a corner room which was nice. Very small gym but at least there was one. Nice bar attached with good range. All in all, a very good downtown Seattle hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms......Bad Attitudes”
Reviews.Author: DrOfWaves
Reviews.Content: The Honeymoon Suite was very nice. The people you had to talk to to get there were not. The desk agents appeared bothered by my presence and the bar tender in the Bookstore definitely was. We had to wait an hour and a half (until 430p) for our room so we went to the bar. Bad idea. Ended up across the street at the Hotel 1000.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: vlcowles
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Alexis really took care of us! We checked in and received room 401, a king deluxe. As a Kimpton in touch member I had requested a quiet room away from the elevators as I had read previous reviews that the elevators were old and noisy. That was very true in this room and also seemed to have a ventilation noise and vibrations that were very annoying. I hate to complain but decided tom go ask for a room change, Jenn and Katlyn took awesome care of us and didn't make me feel bad for wanting to move. The first room they gave us was smaller than our first one so we again asked for another one and they came through in grand fashion. Our room couldn't be nicer and were very happy. This is a lovely hotel in a great location to walk to everything. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and well located”
Reviews.Author: sebage
Reviews.Content: Well appointed rooms and friendly staff. Walking distance to Pike Place. Parking is expensive, but there are plenty of local garages to use instead.

Reviews.Title: “So many things done right..l”
Reviews.Author: clrWashngton_DC
Reviews.Content: This hotel does so many things right: Â glass of wine at night; great food (albeit only casual dining); Monday night at the movies (in the bar); coffee/tea in morning; free Internet wi-fi; beautiful architecture and interesting art; friendly staff; courtesy umbrella in the closet, etc. One problem we had was getting heat in our room. Â  We changed rooms once and then 3 visits from the engineering (over 24 hours) before we got reliable heat. Â The front desk apologized, set chocolates up there really isn't a substitute for heat. I suspect we were just unlucky; I would certainly stay again. Â  What annoyed me was soap, shampoo, etc in little pump bottles. Â  It was nice stuff Gilchrist and Soames but the pump really did not work--what fun in the shower-trying get the pump to work.Â

Reviews.Title: “Great base to see Seattle”
Reviews.Author: rheo3000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexis for one night many months ago. The suite was beautiful and clean and the bed was crazy comfortable. The location of the hotel is a great place to get to other parts of the city. We ate at the Space Needle restraurant and were able to walk, no problem. We reserved our table at the Space Needle through the hotel and for the privlege were treated to a free dessert (quite a nice surprise.) Overnight there was a problem with guests in the hotel and I had a terrible nights sleep. We let staff know at the desk when we checked out and they apologized profusely. When I got home I had a 'rate your experience' email from Kimpton. I replied and was honest that the hotel was great, but my experience was ruined by the problem guests and the hotel manager offered us another opportunity to try the hotel, and since we are close, we took her up on it. I am so glad that we did. The two rooms we stayed in were so different from each other, but both of them were clean, quiet and spacious. We were just so pleased with how all staff treated us and I was pleased that I voiced concerns and they were taken seriously by the hotel manager. When I have the opportunity I will try to stay in a Kimpton Hotel ... we are going to try out the Vero beach resort in December and are hoping that the great service and rooms is on the east coast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Not So Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kris C
Reviews.Content: This truly is a gorgeous property and the rooms are beautiful as well, however, the staff leaves something to be desired. The staff at this hotel came very close to ruining a good portion of my wedding day because of their lack of attention to detail. I had worked with a staff member to preview and book a suite in the hotel at the end of July for my wedding that was in early November. Two days before the wedding one of our family members called to pay for one of our nights at the hotel and NO RESERVATIONS! The person we worked with was less than helpful to fix the situation and the two other people we spoke with took a totally indifferent attitude, it was unbelievable. We had to resort to yelling at the person and requesting several times to speak to a manager, who has still yet to return my calls. In the end they gave us a room similar to the one I was supposed to have, but not without a whole bunch of unnecessary stress two days before my wedding. The suite that we had was beautiful, PNW ballet themed, and had a great view of the water. I found the front desk staff to be annoyed with any request we made, and we were not particularly high maintenance only asked for some extra pillows and blankets. I wish I could say that my husband and I would be back to celebrate our anniversary next year but I just cannot justify the price for lack luster service at best.

Reviews.Title: “anniversary happiness in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: muttlover
Reviews.Content: Had our 35th wedding anniversary in Seattle at the Alexis, and decided we'll return for our 5oth! Excellent location on 1st ave,, walking distance to Pioneer Sq, Ferries, Art museum, Pike Place Market, and Public Library ( straight uphill tho ). They were remodeling lobby a bit - not the most inviting to sit leisurely in, I must say. The front desk staff were fantastic - on check in, during our stay, check out, and when I left my camera charger they were quick to call and mailed it down. Kudos to Lisa! We were graciously upgraded for our anniversary to a King deluxe, beautiful large essentially studio size apartment with king bed, sitting area with sofa, easy chairs, flat screen tv. Bathroom clean, well appointed, a little dated. Bed super comfortable, tho I found pillows too firm and hard for my liking. Brunch in " The Library Bistro " was superlative, with great service. Will be a regular at the Kimpton chain in the future based on this stay. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel: top notch”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlusterful
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our 3-night stay at the Alexis! The location was fantastic, and the staff were ALL friendly, helpful and professional. We originally booked a single queen room, but paid the extra to upgrade to a 2-queen: we were given a lovely corner suite on the Madison St. side (quieter). The room was very clean, well-appointed and had a monster-sized TV. The pillows were heavenly: a super-firm and a super-squishy, and you can choose which type you want. Down comforter and lush sheets were so appreciated at the end of a long day on our feet. The tall ceilings and high drapes made it feel very elegant. I really appreciated that all the staffers were smiling, and although I don't have a pooch it was cool that they had a little welcome board with arriving puppies' names on it, and doggie biscuits :) We will most definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “I want to live here full time.....”
Reviews.Author: gelpete
Reviews.Content: I love this place so much I want to live there. Its a classic Kimpton, eclectic, artistic, warm and relaxed. Lots of great little touches (for dog owners there is a water bowl in the lobby and a little white board with the visiting dogs names). Spacious rooms, easy upgrade (they sent me an e-mail with a full range of possible upgrades) when from a king deluxe to king suite for about ten bucks a night. No two lamps, or mirrors or chairs or pieces of art in your room are the same yet it all works and all comes together. High ceilings arched windows, high end plumbing fixtures (so smooth when you turn the handle) luxury without pretension. Ideally located about four blocks from the market six block from Pioneer Square, and easy uphill walks too anywhere downtown you would like to be. Plenty of good food in the neighborhood along with some very interesting shopping and galleries. I would (and will) stay at this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Seattle Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: DeborahALosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous stay at the Alexis hotel in Seattle. I highly recommend. The best location for sightseeing in Downtown Seattle, Waterfront, Markets, Seattle Art Museum, great shopping. Hotel is beautifully decorated, contemporary, beautiful art from SAM, delicious food in both room service and the cozy restaurant, wine in the afternoon, and to top it all off, a friendly, attentive staff. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!!”
Reviews.Author: Kato007
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in late October and this hotel is one of the best we have stayed in. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the hotels location to restaurants, transport and tourist hot spots is just fabulous. Our 6th floor room was spacious and the room including shower was always very clean. A couple of aspects about our stay we really appreciated were; the comfort of the King bed and absolutely no traffic noise despite being on 1st Avenue. This was our first visit to Seattle and we would return to this hotel anytime. They provide complimentary high speed wireless internet access and each evening, wine tasting in the foyer. If you need an interesting bar/cafe, check out the Bookstore Bar in the same building. If you found this review helpful, please vote....

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DoctorM
Reviews.Content: The Alexis is in a great location for tourists to Seattle: walking distance of Pike Market, Pioneer Square, the waterfront, and the ferry terminal. I was upgraded to a fantastic room on the 5th floor with a real fireplace and a separate sitting room and TV room. The Alexis is not as trendy as some Kimpton hotels but it is very comfortable and quiet. The Alexis has only a lobby bar for lunch and dinner so you will need to walk for breakfast or order off room service. Be sure that you sign up for the on-line Kimpton rewards program which grants you free internet and a $10 voucher to raid the mini-bar. One heads-up: the local governments have put a punitive tax rate onto local parking fees. So be prepared for a 25% sticker shock added to your daily parking tab.

Reviews.Title: “Top choice in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Basiluzzo
Reviews.Content: I work in Seattle from time to time and always stay at the Alexis. The service is attentive and personal, the rooms spacious and comfortable, and the location fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Does it Again!”
Reviews.Author: GPendragon
Reviews.Content: Loved my time spent at the Alexis Hotel in Seattle. Our fireplace room was H-U-G-E! Of course the staff was more than helpful and kind. They were so hospitable during the hosted wine hour and when we needed dinner reservations or directions they nearly bent over backward to accommodate us. When we had an issue with our room being too close to the elevator, we were, without question, moved to another room equivalent to the one we had originally booked. The Library Bar was warm and inviting. We enjoyed drinks before sightseeing and dinner. The Library Bistro was equally lovely with delicious and generous portions of carefully planned menu items. Would love this Kimpton to have a Club Level, but even without one we still felt well taken care of. Thank you Alexis Hotel! Cannot wait to visit Seattle again, and when I do, you can bet that we'll be staying at Alexis. Oh, and of course, the Alexis is in a fantastic location to shopping, the market, the ferries, Seattle Center....everything!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the customer service”
Reviews.Author: Sue P
Reviews.Content: The Alexis blends in perfectly with the area and is in a great location. We had a car but never used it the entire weekend since everything we wanted to see was within walking distance. I've stayed here a few times for business and pleasure and I find the staff professional, courteous and intent on making your visit a great experience. Be sure to have a cocktail or two in the Library Bar. Staff were diligent in tending to drink orders without being solicitous. The lunch and dinner menu selections are varied and prepared well. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable with nice beds and several seating options. I found the valet parking to be high at $36 per day but we parked in a covered public parking structure one block down from the hotel that cost $12 per 24 hours. Still, parking in this city is not cheap and with valet you certainly pay for that convenience. This is a hotel I will continue to visit when in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Desiree1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very cute, in a great location, and a great price. The staff is very welcoming and helpful. The hotel is also pet friendly which I thought was cute seeing the owners with their well behaved pets walking around (I was there for business so sans pet.) Room service was fast and very good. The only minor thing why I didn't list 5 stars, the bathroom set up is kind of difficult for a female traveler. No where to put makeup or curling iron/flat iron, just a small sink (but it does make sense to keep the architectural feel of the era of the building.) It was easy to walk to the water, to Pike's, and many restaurants and coffee shops. Next time I am in Seattle, I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and excellent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: karsmith
Reviews.Content: We had decided to stay somewhere a little cheaper in Seattle and in checking back at one point, found that through Hotels.com, they had a rate that was LESS than where we were staying so we switched! We had a basic Queen room, but it was quite large and very interesting in architecture. It was quiet (thankfully), and overlooked a little courtyard (it was on the 4th floor). The staff were great - the concierge had sent the information I had requested to a wrong email address and I didn't get it - he though made up for it with a bottle of wine and some fruit in our room. Very nice touch! It was nice to run down to get coffee complimentary in the morning and enjoy it in our room. We walked nearly everywhere as the location was terrific. Being lovers of single malt scotch we also enjoyed the very extensive list of same in the Library Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pamela H
Reviews.Content: We ended up getting a great deal on Orbitz and could afford to stay a few days at the Alexis Hotel. We got a great corner room that was two walls of windows on the 4th floor. It was quiet, comfy, and romantically cozy. The a/c was a bit loud, but it wasn't so loud that it bothered me. The bathrooms were stocked with amazing toiletries. If you forgot something, they had nearly everything available to you with a phone call - including a hair straightener! My favorite part is the complimentary wine hour with local reds & whites. The staff was super helpful 24/7 and I couldn't have been more relaxed. Highly recommend :)

Reviews.Title: “a relaxing time away”
Reviews.Author: iluvmyshihtzu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love the Alexis Hotel. We have stayed at all three Kimpton properties in the Seattle area including the Alexis a number of times. The Alexis has always done us with a hospitable and relaxing experience. We visited on Friday October 7th on a last minute decision a few days prior. As always, the front desk staff are so warm and welcoming. Upon checking in. in casual conversation we said we were there to relax and my husband had just passed a big certification exam for his PMP (project management professional certification). He hadn't studied so hard since highschool! :-) When we came back from dinner and listening to live music on the town we opened our door and there was a really nice note congratulating my husband for being so studious and a plate of fresh fruit and a nice bottle of wine. These attention to details make Kimpton brand why we like to stay there especially the comfort and warmth of the Alexis Hotel. The beds are extremely comfortable and we love the down comforters. The evening wine hour is a nice touch. We always look forward to the yummy breakfast in the Library bistro! Thanks again Alexis for a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: Shawn H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Seattle on short notice and after a quick look on trip advisor decided to stay at the Alexis. The excellence started at the curb in front of the hotel with the valet parking and continued though out check in and then on to a truly awesome room ( the symphony suite) at a price that was a good value for money. A very well appointed room, large with comfortable furniture and bed, High ceilings, and was SPOTLESS. A truly relaxing experience. We will definitely stay there again and will look for Kimpton hotels in any city we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter16
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel based on the great reviews and they were right. The location is perfect for sightseeing. We were able to walk to Pike Place Market, SAM (Seattle Art Museum), the waterfront, the Seattle underground and the Space Needle. The room was nice and spacious and the decor was great. The bed was super comfy and the bathroom was also very nice. The hotel was very clean and there was a nice attention to detail. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Seattle and wanting to walk to all of the tourist attractions. The only issue I had was with the costs for parking ($87 for two nights). I realize that parking in downtown is pricey but felt this was just too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, Great spot to recuperate”
Reviews.Author: Tooheyspete
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2011 for a few days with my wife and baby. We were upgraded to a suite which was fantastic - given we had a baby it meant we could put her to bed and remain up to relax. We all got ill on the day we arrived not the result of the hotel, and the room was big enough for us not to get cabin fever. It was a bit light on in terms of the restaurant, though everything else was fine. Would recommend for location & nice rooms - older style decor,

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: FarWest604
Reviews.Content: Thanks, Tripadvisor, for helping me pick another winner! Based on thereviews I read here, we booked a 2 night stay at the Alexis before taking a 1-day cruise back home to Vancouver. The location was great - walk to the pike place market, SAM, Nordstrom and Pacific Place shopping centre. Also near to some great pubs and restaurants - see my other reviews on Brooklyn, McCormick & Schmick, and the Biscuit b!tch!. Loved that they had happy hour each evening from 5-6pm in the lobby - free wine or beer! They also do free coffee/tea in the lobby each morning to enjoy on site or to go. While this was a nice touch, I would have preferred an in-room coffee maker so we could have a cup while we were getting ready. The room was beautifully decorated with an enormous bathroom and closet, and a small sitting area and desk.We paid for a standard room, so weren't dissapointed that we didn't have a view.
