Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days in this hotel last October. Though I wasn't very lucky with the weather - yes, it was raining in Seattle - I was quite happy that after much research and a good deal I landed at the Alexis. The location is great - 1st Avenue a few blocks from Pike's Market, plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby. When I arrived I thought I'd ended up at one of these old fashioned worn hotels, but it had undergone a great revamp in recent years. The room was nicely appointed, really big, very comfortable bed, nice bathroom. My only comment was that it was a bit too dark. Most hotels tend to be around this area, and being so close to the port you are bound to hear some horns from large ships at night, but it's not really disturbing. This is yet another reason to get the Alex (a 4-floor building) rather than one of these higher priced options with "room view", as you will get a view of the docks, which is not very glorious. I didn't use the restaurant, but I'd like to mention that their bar in front of the hotel looked really inviting. And it was always full of "real" people, not the usual scene that you get in the trendier hotels. Service was always friendly and timely, and the rooms were really clean. I'd recommend Cafe Fonte, 2 or 3 blocks away at 1st Av, which has a fabulous coffee ( you need to be really good to stand out in Seatlle) and a smart selection of meals (breakfast through dinner) and wine. And there are also plenty of good choices at Pike's, especially if you like seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mandy788
Reviews.Content: Just back from 2 nights at the Alexis in an upgraded King room. Everything was great, very clean spacious room and they were very welcoming to our dog. The bathroom and carpet could use a bit of an update in the room we were in, but for the $140 a night we couldnâ€™t really complain! Staff were very friendly but we were disappointed upon arriving back to our room after midnight that we were not able to get a bottle of wine sent up (on a Friday night!) as the restaurant/room service was closed. Parking is expensive, but that seems to be the norm in Seattle. Regardless, we will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “A sophisticated and elegant hotel with wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: superhappyfunartist
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here at the Alexis. The service is very friendly and attentive. The hotel has an upscale, contemporary and sophisticated vibe. Everything is spotless. My husband and I were permitted to check in early and we were very pleased with the room; it was quite large, the decor stylish and the king-size bed was quite comfortable. We requested a quiet room in a quiet part of the hotel and they delivered just that. The only minor noise problem we experienced was the sound of the room fan turning on and off as it maintained the room temperature. I imagine most people wouldn't even notice it. Internet access was included with the room, which we quite appreciated. The one thing I liked least about my stay at the Alexis was the on-site restaurant. The "Library Bistro" was very disappointing mainly because it was closed at all times except for breakfast. There was a small pub-style facility also within the hotel that offered meals from the Bistro's kitchen, but it was always crowded in there and I generally don't like eating dinner in a noisy bar. It seemed odd that this spacious restaurant would be closed while the bar was overflowing with people seeking a meal (and not just a drink). I did manage to have breakfast there one morning and unfortunately found the food to be rather mediocre. I suggest avoiding their scrambled eggs. Overall, I rate this hotel as one of the best I've ever stayed at. The only issue was the restaurant that was only open for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I love Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Veroxin
Reviews.Content: I love Seattle. I have been there twice before this is the best hotel. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely rooms, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: BequiaWhispers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days on buisness, but with my wife accompanying me. The concierge and reception staff could not have looked after my wife better - they were brilliant!!! No question was too difficult for them, and they arranged trips etc for her flawlessly. I travel a great deal, but this is one of the best hotels I have ever been in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: IsThatASeaTurtle
Reviews.Content: The Alexis Hotel is a tasteful hotel in an excellent downtown location. My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our anniversary. We have traveled extensively and are not easily impressed. It was a special anniversary so we stayed in the Honeymoon Suite. It was very nice. Because we had booked late, we needed to move to another suite for the 2nd night. We stayed in a corner suite where we could watch the ferrys and ships in the harbor - it was wonderful. The suites very spacious, tastefully decorated, clean and comfortable. The staff was simply amazing. They were always helpful and friendly. My only suggestion would be a coffee/tea maker in the room - but we never asked for one, so maybe they were available for the asking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Alexis”
Reviews.Author: Makai
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Alexis hotel. We found the staff to be friendly and very helpful. Our room did not have a working television so the front desk upgraded us to a corner suite where we had more than just a TV to enjoy. The hotel location is perfect for exploring the city. We really enjoy Kimpton properties and found the Alexis to be an exceptional offering. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Always love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: justme2112
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Alexis a few times in the past. Each time is a pleasure. I am departing Tuesday for yet another visit. It feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Floridabarb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexis from Oct.1-4 and were totally wowed by this hotel! From the well dressed, friendly town car driver (pre-arranged by the front office manager, Woody) who picked us up at the airport, to the front desk staff, wait staff, etc. we were constantly surrounded by people who only wanted us to completely enjoy our stay. They were all accomodating, friendly, knowledgeable, and professional. The hotel itself is gorgeous and we stayed in the most beautiful top floor corner suite with an expansive bay view, dining and living rooms, furnished with elegant linens and draperies - all in a very central, walk to everything location. It's a short walk to the Pike Place market from here, but you don't get the noise and bustle of the market! The food in their restaurants was extremely good,especially the breakfasts and the clam chowder, loaded with clams still in the shell and we even had dinner one night at the Vintage Park Hotel restaurant , which is a sister Kimpton hotel to the Alexis, and that was also fantastic. The wine tastings each evening allowed us to meet other guests in a congenial atmosphere. We no longer have to wonder where to stay in Seattle....we have found exactly what we like in a hotel at the Alexis and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on West Coast trip”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaDuck
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for four business travelers for one overnight stay. Of five hotels in five different cities, this was by far their favorite hotel of the trip. Not only is it a beautiful hotel but it is conveniently located and offers travelers many "extras" such as coupons for breakfast and honor bar food. Parking was expensive ($36) but they were able to walk to their event so there was no need to drive once they arrived in Seattle. Will definitely use the Alexis Hotel for future stays in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “finally found the seattle hotel we want to come back to”
Reviews.Author: heartles
Reviews.Content: staying with mom (who lives in seattle) is no longer an option when we visit ... so we have been staying all over downtown seattle in our many trips to see family over the years ... and finally ... we have found the hotel to come back to. the alexis was such a great choice .. it is beautiful, has great energy, smells good!!! has a great staff - all of which were so accommodating to our every request and the whole stay was just an overall wonderful experience. we walked to the baseball stadium, pike place market, the ferries, the aquarium, just was able to walk EVERYWHERE and we had a car that just sat. and the room, so clean, comfortable and just nice. upon checking-in, coming and going and leaving, the front desk staff always seemed to be smiling and saying hi or bye ... we felt so very welcome there. i thought that having a small child may not be the "demographic" for that hotel - but trust me - i never felt my child was a burden or not welcome .. they even allow dogs .. so very cool .. thanks to all at the alexis .. we will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed rooms in a beautifull hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler38
Reviews.Content: The service and staff were wonderful. I can't say enough about the rooms! I will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE the Kimptons and especially the ALEXIS”
Reviews.Author: suitcasesis
Reviews.Content: I plan group travel for women (the Pink Suitcase Sisters) and we have stayed at this Kimpton two years in a row and will be back in 2010!! This hotel and EVERYONE that works there is fabulous. Especially Angie, who helped me with the group. It is in a great location (right down the street from Pike's Market) and in the middle of some fabulous shops. Don't be afraid to go in the jewelry store next door to them because you this it is too pricey....the prices are great and the jewelry is wonderful. I got a one of a kind ring made by a great artist and it was only $80. The Alexis is great and I recommend it to all my clients going to Seattle and we can't wait to go back next August!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: bcck
Reviews.Content: The room was luxurious, super clean, well decorated. Probably because it was a downtown hotel in an old building the room was on the small size, but the bathroom was large with a good shower and beautiful marble floor and countertops. The service is outstanding. Very easy to walk to just about anything you'd want to do in Seattle-waterfront, stadiums, shopping, Pike Place Market and Pioneer Square.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay at a truly great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GuitarBuilder
Reviews.Content: This was a weekend getaway in celebration of our 30th wedding anniversary. I advised the hotel that we were there for a special occasion, and throughout our stay we received numerous courtesies. We stayed in the Pacific Northwest Ballet Suite, which was sunny and spacious with a water view and beautiful photos and memorablia from the PNB. The hotel's recent renovation is evident everywhere, and luxious linens and Aveda products in the large and beautifully furnished suite add to the sense of luxury. Both the Library Bistro and the Bookstore Bar were first rate, and the Alexis is ideally situated for an easy stroll to virtually all downtown restaurants and attractions. If you arrive with a car for more distant excursions, the parking valet service is swift and efficient. This is a hotel that makes you feel like their "guest" in the very BEST sense of the word. In a word: PERFECT.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: KearstinB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexis 5 nights when we visited Seattle on our anniversary and I don't think we could have made a better hotel choice. The location is great, we reserved a car from the airport to get there and were able to walk or take the bus to wherever we wanted to go. It's a short 10 minute walk to Pike Place (uphill, but then what isn't in Seattle?) with plenty of interest to see on the way and several good restaurants in the area and a nice bar just downstairs. Like much of the city, the clientele on this street is eclectic, you'll walk past a wide variety of establishments, but nothing where I didn't feel comfortable going out on my own. When I told them we were there for our anniversary, they bumped us to a king room with a sitting room at no charge. Additionally, we showed up early and they held our bags until check in, no questions asked (any good hotel *should* do this, but the response can be surprising) as well as holding the bags for the couple of hours between when we checked out and when the car picked us up. The room was lovely - comfortable, spacious and well appointed. The view wasn't awesome, we just saw the top of the next building over, but we had curtains drawn for privacy most of the time anyway. The bathroom was beautiful as well, marble everything and garden tub - the Aveda toiletries were a nice tie in to the salon downstairs. Usually I don't really care about hallway decor in a hotel, other than that it's tasteful, but the artwork on display at the Alexis is wonderful. We have a ballerina in the family and took several photos of the displays just to show her. The only drawbacks I identified were - that I could have done without walking past the Aveda salon coming in and out, after a day or two, the fumes got to be a bit wearing. - that the desk staff weren't terribly knowledgeable about the less tourist-y attractions in the area (we were doing more of an 'off the beaten path' focus) Overall, it was a refreshing change to stay somewhere with personality and charm, rather than the usual cookie cutter modern hotel - definitely worth the extra $20-30. I make a point to recommend the Alexis to anyone we know visiting Seattle and now try to find Kimpton hotels whenever we travel. Note: Be sure to sign up for the Kimpton rewards membership before you check in so you get points for your current stay. I didn't notice it until we were checking out (I'm sure they would have taken care of it if I had said something, but I was a bit flustered trying to get all those last minute things taken care of before we left town).

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: csmac
Reviews.Content: Just as I am baffled by the stellar reviews for the appalling Inn At The Market in downtown Seattle, I'm not sure the Alexis merits the spate of poor reviews here. We moved to the Alexis after two nights at the run-down and pretty ghastly Inn. We booked into the Authors' Suite at a rate we considered entirely acceptable. So, the good, bad and so on... Bad first: housekeeping really needs to get its act together. Very variable service: noticed one dirty wine glass remained uncleaned for four days! The Authors' Suite has zero view, looking out onto an alley. The bathroom could do with an update. Useful but over-priced valet parking. Good: friendly welcome (Inn At The Market please note and copy); vast room at a reasonable price; comfortable bed; excellent location moments away from the Market, Pioneer Square, etc. So, not the perfect hotel (by a long way) but it balanced location. comfort and price very well - very likely to return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel.. Beware upgrades not really upgrades”
Reviews.Author: Tinamarieri
Reviews.Content: Smaller hotel, great location, 2 blocks up from waterfront, 4-5 blocks to pikes market and shopping district. Rooms clean. Beware of upgrade offer. We made a reservation for an "Alexis Guestroom with one king bed on a higher floor" - the description specifically stated "all offering city views" and a few days later received an e-mail asking us if we wanted to go on their "eStandby" list for a potential upgrade to a deluxe king room for an additional $9.00 more per night. The deal was that you would not know if it was available until you checked in and if upgrade was not you would keep your original reservation and rate. Sounded like a great deal since deluxe room was significantly more than $9.00 more if we had booked it originally. When we checked in we were informed that we were "in luck" that the upgrade was available. What we were given was a larger room on the second floor facing an alley. When we asked the front desk staff about this we were told that it was a much larger room. We did not feel as though this was an upgrade as we did not come all the way from RI to Seattle to look at the alley. The other bad part of this was that the alley is also where the dumpsters are located and we were there for 4 days and the trucks came two different days at 4:30 am for the trash and then again at 5 :00 am for the cans/bottles. We mentioned this to the front desk staff when we checked out and the told us they had no control over when the city picked up the trash. There are plenty of other hotels in Seattle, we will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable and spacious”
Reviews.Author: holiday092
Reviews.Content: The Alexis hotel is absolutely beautiful. We had a room with two double beds, and what we werent expecting was the huge roomthey were in, complete with lounge and sitting chair, desk and small sink to prepare food. the room was the largest ive stayed in, was very clean and the bathroom was spacious. The Alexis is in a great location, only a fifteen minute walk to the victoria clipper and less to the other ferry terminals. The Pike place market is only 10 minutes walk and the shops not far past that. (we recommend the seattle food tour of the markets). staff were very helpful, especially Woody on check in (what a spunk!!), they also have free internet at the check in desk which is great for checking in for your flight, restaurant and local info.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable, and well-located”
Reviews.Author: ccusim1048
Reviews.Content: The Fireplace Suite was very large and well-appointed. The staff-was attentive. Complimentary wine hour from 5-6 pm daily was a nice way to kick off the evening. Ethera Salon Spa offered happy hour 30 minute massages for great price - see Meggan, she is an artist and a healer. They offer a wonderful steam room which requires coordination with the front desk which did not go perfectly. Otherwise, 5 stars all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, great location, wonderful ambiance”
Reviews.Author: mjtraveler22
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with an art theme. I had an executive suite with wonderful decor and lots of intriguing contemporary artwork. Overall, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location is very convenient: 1-2 blocks from restaurants Ivar's and McCormicks, a 5-block walk to Pike Place Market, near bus lines, close to the light rail coming this summer, short walk to stadiums, etc. The onsite restaurant was efficient, friendly, and offered good food. This hotel stretches across 3 old buildings. I was in the "north tower", where the plumbing and air conditioning worked well. While the decor was excellent, the bathroom was very small. The floor above me creaked when people walked around, and the street noise was fairly loud. There is no view, but typically none of the Kimpton hotels I have stayed in have a view to speak of. So I think that is not an emphasis of the chain. Another problem with Kimpton chains is that the fitness centers tend to be sub-par, and the Alexis is even below that. The fitness center is a small room with one recumbent bike, 2 ellipticals and 1 treadmill, and a small fan on the floor. But these complaints are really nit picks in a hotel that is a privilege to discover. I definitely plan to return and feel that this hotel's ambiance was a big contributor to the enjoyment of my trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel family, What a home away from home, What a city”
Reviews.Author: drkeith3
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I decided a day prior to visit Seattle for one day and head to Alaska! On recommendation we booked at the Alexi. I am a Corporate President, I travel around the world, I stay only at 5 star hotel chains - Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, and Westin &Fairmont are my homes 3 to 4 days a week. I was open to the Boutique concept and gave it a try. WHAT A FAMILY! From the greetings of the staff at the Bell Desk, to the Front desk, to even the dog that was behind the desk being watched by the staff - I was truly welcomed to the Alexi. The hotel room was spectacular and am still amazed at the price. Yes, it was a great Junior Suite, the amenties were amazing. I particularly enjoyed the Aveda products considering I am 16 year user of the natural enhancers. The food and bar were better than any hotel in New York. I can go on and on, but I want to write this most important point - We only wanted to stay a day - we left 4 days later, because we truly felt at home. The personal touches from remembering my name, to the wine I had the night before, to my pants being neatly folded and placed in my closet. Thank you Kimpton, for creating a space that is relaxing, a family that is commited and extended, an atmosphere that welcomes you and keeps you, and a value that assures a speedy return. What a City, What a Home, What a Family - Thanks Alexi!s

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TTATUM
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Alexis, but have to admit that my next stay will be across the street at the Hotel 1000. We stayed in a spa suite hotel room at the Alexis, and don't get me wrong the room was very nice, I just would've appreciated more of a view. The hotel is only a few stories high and doesn't give much of a view from any of it's rooms. Other than that small "issue" i thought this was an overall nice hotel. The staff was very helpful. I enjoyed the wine tasting in the lobby that they present to guests each night. Along with the water painting offered for the kids ( or the kid in you). Beautiful art work is everywhere and nice eateries on site. Great location in downtown seattle, within walking distance of some GREAT restaurants ( The MET was great!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at a great boutique hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mech986
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience with a Kimpton property but it certainly won't be the last. We stayed at the Alexis for 6 days in April 2009, partly for business (a conference for me) and leisure (wife and daughter catching up with sister-in-law). Since my conference hotel had no rooms big enough for us (my daughter is handicapped and wheelchair bound) I searched for a hotel with a large suite at a good value. While I looked at the Hotel Monaco, the Alexis caught my eye. We setttled on the Fireplace suite, an 850 sq. foot room with fireplace, expansive dining table for 6, sofabed, separate bedroom with King bed, and a nicely set up bathroom/bath. With the Kimpton promotion of 30% off for stays over 3 days, the cost was minimally more than I would have paid for a standard hotel room at the conference hotel. Also, I was only 4 blocks awar from the conference and closer still to the water and piers. Although we arrived late on day 1 after gathering all our gear and a minivan at SEA-TAC, the hotel had a valet to greet us and help us shuttle our stuff to the room on the second floor. The flowers I requested were there (great choice, very fragrant) + the rollaway for our daughter. Lots of space to work in as there was a long counter with sink, honor bar fridge which we emptied onto the opposite counter, and put my daughters medications and formulas into. My wife marvelled at the room's size, decor (great paintings on entry with nice accent lighting), and layout. (won some points with this choice). It did face the western alley looking directly back to another office building but it was relatively quiet and very comfortable. Beds were very comfortable, 37" LCD TV's with remotes, bathroom was great except for small amount of counter space around sink. shower was great, nice and hot with good pressure at all hours of the day. Had a great recommendation from the front desk for a late take out snack from McCormick and Schmick's on the next corner. The front Desk check in was great, the valets were ALWAYS ready with our car when we called and helped us with our wheelchair stowage or packages, and were very friendly, calling us by name each day. Note that there are two drop off areas - in front facing east, and to the south side. The front is used during most of the day but there is no stopping during some parts of the rush hours so they take you in from the south if needed. However, the main entrance is the only one handicap accessible, the south side has stairs that lead to the Library Bistro. Not a problem for us once we learned the layout. My sister-in-law also enjoyed visiting with us and felt the room was a hit and a great value. The food at the Library and Bookstore (same kitchen) was excellent day and night. The art all around the hotel added a nice sophisticated touch. The concierge was quite helpful and even came out to our car to deliver a specific map we had requested. The hotel's housekeeping staff was very good, cleaning each day when we requested it and provided a turn down service too. They were respectful of all our stuff (we do spread out in a room!!) yet tidied up quickly and efficiently. They certainly earned their gratuity at the end of our stay. Both the wired and wireless internet worked quite well, nice to have two ways to hook up since we brought 2 laptops with us. The only glitch was one faulty network cable which was easily exchanged at the front desk. I travel reasonably often and stay at a lot of different chains and properties. This was one of my best stays and my wife, daughter, and sister-in-law enjoyed having the Alexis as our Seattle base - we looked forward to returning back to our "second" home each eveing and relaxing by the fire. We had no problems with internal noise, and only 1 day was there outside noise - a compressor or jackhammer run by either a city crew or one of the crew workinig on the hotel/building facade starting at 7am!!. The manager apologized profusely and their schedule was delayed to after 8am. When we visit Seattle again, we'll stay at the Alexis! I can't see any reason to look for anything else! Regards, The Yee's PS - Loved seeing Lily, the resident dog/pet relations agent in the lobby. She's nicely mannered and comfortable around people. Adds a nice homey touch.

Reviews.Title: “May be in for a (bad) surprise”
Reviews.Author: traveling_minx
Reviews.Content: I booked the Premier Suite with King bed at 650+ square feet with 2 floors for a 4 night stay in April 2009. We came here on vacation for a special occasion, so we wanted to splurge a bit. Let me preface to say that my husband and I are globe-trotters and travel extensively. This would have made our 5th visit to Seattle. THE GOOD: Location: Cannot ask for a better location. Within walking distance to Pikes, shopping & restaurants. Close to all the action but not in the middle of it â€“ perfect! Would prefer to stay in this area from here on. Hotel Staff: Got prompt and courteous response from manager. Cleanliness: Lobby & public areas were great. Room â€“ wellâ€¦..needs improvement. Library Bar: Great service, great drinks. Parking: If you donâ€™t want to pay for the valet, there is plenty of street parking at that area underneath the bridge. If you wait till after 4, you can pay for 2 hours of parking (time limit) and 6pm to 8am is free! THE BAD: Housekeeping: came & went at inconsistent hours â€“ either early in the morning or as late as 6:30pm. When we happened upon her at 6:30, she wasnâ€™t even finished and just had her take off than finish. After 4 nights, they never cleared the foyer table of an ice bucket and soda cans/ wine bottles. A clearly visible watery mess for 4 days. If not for us, think about that lovely furniture getting water-logged! One day we found dirty linen lying in the middle of the hallway. Bellman: At arrival, our taxi dropped us off at the entrance near the Library bar. This is one floor below the rest of the hotel. Although the bellman was there to greet us, they did not carry our luggage up the steps and there was no elevator. Needless to say, Iâ€™m one of those gals who bring baggage heavier than themselves, so this was not a good start. Concierge: MIA. Apparently out on vacation and not another one to fill in during his absence. So much for using this service for our pampering holiday. Mysteriously, we did get a note in our room upon our arrival from him congratulating us for our special occasion. Nice touch, but who really wrote it?!! Room Amenities: With all my travels, I never got an option of a 2-floored room so I specifically got the room with the 2nd floor. I was expecting a 2nd floor but it was instead like a sunken room sort of thing. The living room/bathroom was 3 steps up from the bedroom area. When upon 1st entering, you have a large entry foyer that brings you towards a hallway with a â€œraisedâ€� living area & bathroom, and then continues forward to the bedroom area. After 4 nights at this hotel, I hate to admit that we never used the living area except for to eat a snack for a few minutes. Also, with all the space, youâ€™d think that theyâ€™d have a bigger bathroom, but it was a typical apartment size. Perhaps if that bathroom was as big as the entry foyerâ€¦. Didnâ€™t get the king bed as described in room style. Got a metal queen canopy. Looked great, but that metal skirt / bottom area was a shin splitter more than once. Although there was plenty of furniture, there was no drawer space in any of it. The room was beautifully decorated albeit not well thought-out as far as usablity. Was relegated to using the small file cabinet sized thing in the closet under the safe. Still had to live out of the suitcase in my 650+ sq foot room. TV placement in the bedroom was in the corner. Unfortunately, the canopy bed poster always got in the way, so youâ€™d have to peek around if you want to watch TV in bed. Iron didnâ€™t work. Had to call twice to get a replacement sent. Both TVâ€™s didnâ€™t work upon arrival. Had to get maintenance to fix it. After a few days of running around, it was nice to have that option to watch a movie on demand. Paid for and started to watch Valkarie but after a few minutes of it on, the picture was shaking. Went to the other TV and saw the same shaky picture. Apparently we got the room with the crappy TV connection. THE UGLY: I can deal with all of the above I had mentioned, but this one was really unforgivable. The hot water was intermittent. Either of the sinks had hot water unless the shower was turned on. However, once you got in the shower, youâ€™d get the blast of cold unsuspectingly too. After telling the front desk of this issue on day 2, supposedly they had maintenance in there but still no resolution. Had cold water in cold Seattle in the early spring. Yippee. What did we get for our troubles? A $60 credit from the front desk at check-out (still spent more than $1000) and 40% off of our next stay. Whoohoo! Seriously?!! So as a Kimptonâ€™s InTouch member, Iâ€™ll have to say that this room has been the worst Kimpton room Iâ€™ve ever stayed at. The Monaco in Portland blew you completely away. Too bad because your location is perfect. 40% off my next stay to take a chance of not having hot water, non-working TVâ€™s, no concierge, no luggage help, spotty housekeepingâ€¦would you do it?

Reviews.Title: “Love this Pet Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dogvacationer
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and a great location too! because we were traveling with a dog, we were a bit leary about how the hotel would actually respond to a pet. The staff was wonderful, and made us feel welcome with our pet. They treated Rascal as if he were on of our kids. Rascal is a border collie mix, and has a lot of hair. Referring to the first posters comments about concern over hair, etc. in a dog-friendly hotel...we found our room to be quite clean and pleasant. As a tip for all of you that like to travel with your pets, we always travel with our Kleen Sheets disposable pet bed covers. We just feel it is a nice courtesy to the next guest to try and keep the room clean when we travel with our dog. We put them over the couch or chair cushions, or on the floor where Rascal sleeps. Then we just toss them when we leave. Thanks to all at the Kimpton for making our stay a wonderful one!

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding experience in every way!”
Reviews.Author: YpsilantiTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel -- I am surprised that other reviews noted any bad service, since to a person ALL of the staff here were great. Welcoming, pleasant, professional, helpful - we couldn't have asked for more. The artwork and furnishings are beautiful, our room was absolutely wonderful, well-decorated, comfortable. The Library Bistro and Bookstore Bar were great, one of the best breakfasts we've had, anywhere, with an excellent server, and a wonderful light dinner and drinks later. Internet access was fast and easy, the Aveda products and the mini-bar selections all great. We really loved this place! And of course the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Ambiance - Bathrooms a bit small”
Reviews.Author: TresLaLa
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here all week for work; I joined just for Friday through Sunday. I was greeted upon arrival by Lily, the hotel dog. She's a super cute, if a bit bored, golden retriever/yellow lab-ish dog. They're currently doing some work on the facade, so the hotel is covered with scaffolding on the bottom few floors. The lobby is modern, but still comfy. There were usually people sitting in the lobby, which made it feel a bit homey. Every evening from 5 to 6 PM the hotel hosts a wine happy hour - such a great perk! Each morning until 10 AM they offer coffee in the lobby - also nice, but I'd prefer a coffee pot in the room! Only once while we were in the lobby did I see the Concierge at his/her desk. That was somewhat frustrating when we were trying to find a specific restaurant a bit out of town. Our room was on the small side, but definitely large enough for what we needed. The bed was comfy, but the pillows were a bit too flat - both my hubby & I had to supplement with the firm throw pillows meant as decor. The biggest down side was the bathroom - specifically the pedestal sink. There was very little space for me to put my make-up bag (or even my contact case, toothbrush, etc). Oddly, there wasn't a hook on the back of the bathroom door for PJs... (As you can see, it's the small things that I pay attention to...) We had drinks and a cheese plate in the hotel bar - yum. We just had a few beers (mostly microbrews on tap), but they had some tasty looking & sounding mixed drinks, and many choices of Scotch, Bourbon, etc. The bar seemed popular with people who weren't staying at the hotel, as well - which I liked!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Wonderful Anniversary Spot.”
Reviews.Author: mecanoe
Reviews.Content: We went to Seattle for our 1 yr anniversary. We had a great experience at the Serrano in San Francisco last year-so didn't hesitate to stay at a Kimpton again. The location couldn't have been beat-it was an easy walk to Pike Place Market and Pioneer Square (Underground Tour). We booked a package through their website for hotel and air and were not disappointed. We took the Gray Line bus back to the airport-it was easy to set up and they picked us up at the hotel so we didn't have to walk up to the normal stop. The restaurant was a bit pricey. We ate at Boka across the street for our Anniversary dinner-it was wonderful! We took the Bainbridge Island ferry one day-it was a nice, reasonably priced trip with great views of the skyline. They have a dog in the lobby-so if you dont like dogs-be aware. It was very pet friendly. We love the Aveda ammenities and the bed and linens were very comfortable. Our only issue is the wireless didnt work in our room. We didn't go to Seattle to use our laptop-but it was frustrating. We were on the phone w/ their IT for a 1/2 hour.. we just ended up using the laptop in the lobby instead-not ideal-but it worked for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: JTSF
Reviews.Content: I had a fabulous stay at the Alexis in February. The staff was extremely nice. I liked the free glass of wine at happy hour in the lobby bar (I got there late and they still served it to me). I left my blackberry charger in my room and they recovered it and mailed it back to me. Room was huge and very nicely decorated. Price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Clueless Service at Seattle's Classic Boutique”
Reviews.Author: biztraveler57
Reviews.Content: While I generally make my own arrangements, my wife's company finalized the "retreat stay" at this lovely renovated boutique hotel. It has a good location but customer service from a third-rate staff has me wondering what Kimpton is thinking. From the front desk to the room service to the telephone operator and the garage valet, the Alexis couldn't get anything right. I had to wait for nearly two hours for an ice bucket, they lost my car in the garage and kept me waiting in a cold December morning for 20 minutes while they searched for my vehicle. I complained to the reception desk and they became testy. The general manager did not respond for a month when I sent a complaint letter. Still not resolved with the Alexis. For more than $340 per night you'd think the staff would have been trained for more than Holiday Inn service. Absolutely awful customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, nice service, nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: ByronDreams
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alexis pre-renovation and it was nothing to write home about. The good news is that after the renovation, the place has really turned into a great option in Seattle. The rooms are much nicer now, with warm, updated decor. They are definitely still a little quirky, but contain lots of fun art and furniture. I asked for and was given a massive room by a very friendly check in clerk. This room was so big I could have done several cartwheels in all directions from the center of it. It had a nice work area, huge bed, a dining table for 4, and French doors onto a patio space (the patio space was slightly odd in that it lacked privacy and was shared with other rooms, but in nice weather it would have been a nice touch.) I get the feeling that there is a BIG range of rooms and it helps to be able to articulate what is you want. Nice upside is that the staff actually seems to know the configurations well enough to describe them to you. A big plus and not something that happens in every hotel ("here's a key go have a look for yourself" being the more common response to questions about a hotel's rooms.) This would also be a great place to come with kids as the rooms are easily large enough for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully Trendy and Elegant!”
Reviews.Author: thenakedtraveler
Reviews.Content: I live only two hours north of Seattle, but always find it a pleasure to stay in any three of the Kimpton Group Hotels that the city has to offer. The service is always excellent, the rooms are very clean and large and always decorated beautifully. I usually stay at the Hotel Monaco and this time chose to stay at The Alexis for a change of pace. When I checked in I asked if they were running any specials on any of the larger suites and I was offered a suite at a discounted price, which I decided to go for. I was given a suite on the sixth floor that was very nicely decorated with great furniture and cool art. It also had a great view of Puget Sound. The suite was huge with a nice bathroom, private bedroom, large living room and dining room. (Room #637) The hotel also has a complimentary wine hour in the evenings which is a great way to unwind after a long day. This is a wonderful small hotel that I would highly recommend to the pickiest of travelers. It was the perfect overnight escape! The Aveda spa down in the lobby is very also very convenient. The Alexis is also a short walk to the Pike Street Market where there is lots of great shopping and restaurants! Make sure to have coffee at the original Starbucks and Le Panier for some great sandwiches and pastries! Fran's right down the street from the hotel has amazing chocolates; you must try the salted caramels!

Reviews.Title: “Kimptoms are the best!”
Reviews.Author: alycarleo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a few Kimpton hotels, all of which have been fabulous, and the Alexis was no different. Clean, quiet, and charming, this hotel was perfect for us. We especially loved Lily, the hotel dog who lounges around in the lobby and loves having her belly rubbed. The Library Bistro, which is connected to the hotel, also had a very good breakfast (though it is a bit expensive). The Alexis is not far from Pike Place Market and downtown, which is nice because it is less congested and touristy. The staff was very professional and helpful, but was still laid back (we mean this in a good way). The only downside is that the pillows suck.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: PennProf
Reviews.Content: We were looking for someplace to stay near Pike Market and central to all of downtown Seattle but far enough away not be "touristy". Alexis was perfect. We got a great rate and then they upgraded us to a lovely suite. Enjoyed the hosted wine tasting every night, saved on our restaurant wine bill! Location couldnt have been more convenient to market, shopping and ferry to Bainbridge Island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Well Appointed Rooms, Super Location”
Reviews.Author: Tutweiler
Reviews.Content: My wife, infant son, and I stayed in the Alexis Fireplace suite for a week in January 09. The room was very large and the fireplace a nice touch. Even nicer was the 7' oval boardroom/dining table in the room that accomodated all kinds of entertaining and baby servicing needs. The service here was great - Alexis staff went out of their way to find an electric kettle, and promptly delivered both crib and high chair without complaint or delay. Room service was good quality but expensive as is normal. Super location for walks to Pike Place Market, downtown Seattle sights, and Pioneer Square/Stadium area venues. Considering the size and caliber of the room - I felt prices were extremely competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward to Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: Braxton1236
Reviews.Content: I have not actually stayed at the hotel yet, but my experience so far has been positive. I have spoken with a reservation agent at the hotel to request a honeymoon suite. Unfortunately it was not available, but I did not expect it to be since my honeymoon begins Valentine's Day. She was very professional and clear, which I appreciated. I reserved a Fireplace Suite, and the hotel's website offered a terrific price. My fiance and I aren't very affluent, and she comes from a particularly low-income family with 12 kids, so I want this to be an incredible, memorable experience for her. I chose the Alexis because the price I got was good when compared to other Seattle Hotels of similar calibre, especially for the size of room I booked. After looking at virtual tours of the rooms, I felt the atmosphere was clean, modern and somehow still cozy. My stay here represents a significant and out-of-the-ordinary monitary expenditure for me, and I hope it will be more than worth it, as I anticipate it will be. B. Wilhelmsen

Reviews.Title: “When you thought personal service was lost...”
Reviews.Author: estrohl
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough nice things about the Alexis, as well as the extra care and personal attention given to every guest. My wife and I took a extended road trip up the coast from San Fransisco to celebrate our 4th wedding anniversary, and stayed at the Alexis while in Seattle. I had casually mentioned the reason for our trip while booking on the phone. To our surprise, they had reserved us a larger room complete with fireplace - and there was a personal note from the concierge, bottle of wine and chocolates waiting. The room was immaculate, and set the tone for our Seattle stay. What really sets this hotel apart from others, is the high level of personal service and attention - no matter who you are. I was treated with the same amount of respect unloading my bags in a tattered flannel, straight for the oregon woods, as the older gentleman who pulled up in a Mercedes sedan. I highly recommend this hotel for those looking for a special and memorable experience in Seattle. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Decompress
Reviews.Content: We wanted a relaxing weekend getaway. Our requirements were a hottub, a comfortable bed and a bar close by. We got what we asked for - and Seattle was a great time, too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but excruciatingly noisey”
Reviews.Author: LOinOregon
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't have been so upset, but called a week in advance to request the quietest room in the hotel and was assured all would be well. Upon pre check in once again reiterated my need for quiet room location, ditto on final check in that night. Was assured rooms on 4th floor " well above any street noise"! I beg to differ, at 11:30PM people screaming and shouting, followed by wailing ambulance on 1st Ave first woke us. At 2:30AM was a chopper raping his pipes hard. At 3:30AM an impromptu "drag race" ensued with a couple cars winding up their engines then full screeching tires as they roared off. By 4:30AM I was in the lobby waiting for coffee service to begin at 5AM. My husband who normally sleeps through a hurricane also was "Sleepless in Seattle". Room was exceptionally nice (linens, amenities, etc.), but all we wanted after 8 hours on our feet at the wine show and the drive up from Portland that morning was some sleep. In fairness, front desk was exceptional and did their best to try and make it up to us . After the fact we learned there'd been a shooting near by something the hotel would of course have no control over. Nevertheless, caveat emptor unless you're extreme sound sleeper!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SanDLB
Reviews.Content: We had expected that for $400+ a night we would have been met with friendly service and a nicely kept room at the very least. The rooms were nice except for the fact that when we returned from sight seeing at 6pm none of our party's three rooms had been cleaned! Our phone didn't work, and room service took over an hour to get a turkey wrap (that tasted terrible)! Do not go to this hotel if service is your thing! We were treated with extreme disrespect by the two employees we encountered at the front desk! WHAT A TERRIBLE FIRST IMPRESSION!!! I WOULD NEVER GO BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pete_Sampson
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Alexis without knowing much about it other than it fit into the nebulous "boutique hotel" category that can end up in feast of famine. Hotel Alexis certainly fits into the former. From start to finish of my three-day stay I was impressed. The staff was helpful when I need them and the rooms are nicely appointed. Some boutique hotels feature cold and even impractical architecture, but I certainly did not find that to be the case here. Alexis benefits from a prime location too, just blocks from the Market and the art museum. I was surprised to see that this hotel is dog friendly, but there's certainly little evidence that pets have taken over the hotel. I did see a couple dogs in the lobby (attention if you have allergies). The hotel features a separate restaurant and bar, although I never stopped by either. If you're looking for a near-luxury hotel at a reasonable rate, I strongly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaseB
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. From the moment we stepped in the door we were treated like their best guest. The hotel was busy, but the staff still managed to attend to our needs and make us feel like we were the only ones at the hotel. The wine tasting at 5pm everyday was a nice touch. A glass of wine, meet some guests and mingle with the fantastic staff. Was a great time for relaxation. The hotel is also in a fantastic location. Only a few blocks to Pike Place. We didn't have a view from our room (which was probably the only negative part). Everything else about the hotel though, made up for it :) Definitely stay here on your next visit to Seattle. Well done Alexis & Kimpton on demonstrating what a hotel should be like.

Reviews.Title: “Alexis is Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: kscpdx
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Alexis for business several times this year, and it's just been a consistently wonderful place to stay in downtown Seattle! My husband and I are always treated exceptionally well from the minute we arrive. All the staff--especially the valet staff, front desk and housekeeping--are just superb individuals. As well as they all treat us--the people at the Alexis treat our big dog even better! By the time we leave, it always seems as if our dog has added more fans to his cheering section. The rooms we've stayed in this year have been just lovely--large, quiet and very well-appointed. The beds are comfy and the bathrooms are always well stocked with amenities. If you can, try to get a room in the North Tower as these rooms tend to be a little larger. As Kimpton Returns and AAA members, we've always gotten great rooms at pretty competitive rates. The hotel's small bar and restaurant is a great little place to unwind with an excellent selection of single malts. While their food menu is small, the food has always been excellent. On a nice day, their outdoor seating area is great for people watching on First Avenue. The location of the hotel makes it very convenient to the waterfront, Pike Place Market, SAM and Pioneer Square without being right in the midst of all the noise and crowds (a big plus if you've ever been in Seattle during the busy tourist season). You'd think with their location right on First Avenue that noise would be a problem, but I think their windows must be triple-paned as we've never had difficulty with street noise (and I'm pretty picky about that!). If you want a little oasis of understated luxury in downtown Seattle---the Alexis is your hotel. Can't wait for our next visit at the beginning of December!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at the Alexis!”
Reviews.Author: seven21
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel in a great location! We booked the Seattle Art Museum Suite and it was simply amazing. The room was huge with a large dining and living area with sectional couches. There was also a powder room (half bath) accessible from the living space. The walls are decorated with nice artwork that looks to be available for purchase. The bedroom was large with a very nice bed and windows that open up to see 1st street below. The main bathroom had a jetted tub and a separate (small) shower. I also liked the exposed brick along the back wall of the rooms. The room simply felt comfortable and the service was great. The concierge was extremely helpful when we had a few questions upon arrival. The bar is cozy and the restaurant serves an excellent breakfast. I highly recommend the Alexis Hotel for anyone looking to stay in a cozy, comfortable setting with impeccible service. The attention to details and variety in the decor make this feel more like a home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “What a Lovely Small Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CruiseMoose
Reviews.Content: We just spent one night here, pre-cruise. I wish it could have been more. The hotel was lovely, the people friendly, the location perfect, and our room was funky, cool and comfortable! We had a corner room on a lower level. I was afraid we might be bothered by street noise but, honestly, we didn't hear any noise from the street or the halls or anywhere else. That was fabulous because I'm a very light sleeper. The bed was tremendously comfortable as were all the other room furnishings. The only issue we had was with breakfast service. When I returned home I had an email survey waiting for me which I completed and returned. In it I mentioned the problem. Within 20 minutes I had a very nice response from the food & beverage manager apologizing for the problem. What a surprise! I never expected that. But that's just true of our whole experience with The Alexis......everything surpassed our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Alexis is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Viva_la_Spartans
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the Alexis. We were lucky enough to stay in a corner room, which was massive. Service was outstanding and the location was perfect for all of the main sights (market, Pioneer Square, etc). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JasonJLong
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 3rd anniversary at the Alexis Hotel and had an amazing time! Our room was beautiful and romantic, my wife was overjoyed. I highly recommend the Alexis to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Quality”
Reviews.Author: Travler54
Reviews.Content: We had a nice one night stay at the Alexis. Great location and staff was very helpful. The room was quite small, however.

Reviews.Title: “They don't get any better than this”
Reviews.Author: RonBen
Reviews.Content: I have traveled far and wide. I have stayed in dozens of hotels. This was the best one for the money!!! A combination of: 1. Best location; 2. Great services; and 3. Tasteful dÃ©cor makes it one of the best hotels in the US. If you are in Seattle, don't hesitate to stay there. I highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: shastinag
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! The staff was exceptional.....we happened to arrive a few hours before check in but within 20 minutes our room was ready for us. I had booked a King Suite through WhatAHotel.com and not only was it the cheapest through them but they promise an upgrade at arrival. Wow! is all I can say...we were in a King Spa Suite which was beautiful, the most comfy beds, awesome shower, and HUGE! The location could not have been more perfect. We actually had a view of the water from our room. Continental breakfast was delicious with homemade muffins. We only wish we could have stayed longer. Of course we will stay at the Alexis again as well as book any future hotel stays with WhatAHotel.com Jim and Shastina Sutherlin, Oregon

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Northwesterly
Reviews.Content: Having had an initial contretemp with them about being put in a standard room, rather than the deluxe room we had booked, our two stays with them were great. Hayden sorted out the room issue as soon as she could and was true to her word. 1st Ave rooms can be a little noisy with boy racers with their exra loud exhaust pipes going by, so my tip is to book a room that faces inwards will get you a good night's sleep. The rooms we had were plush, stylish, comfortable and well cared for but maids trying to get into the room in the early evening when you're "between outfits" can be a little unnerving! Very convenient for both Pike Place Market, Pioneer Sq and the waterfront without tackling the somewhat severe hills in Seattle - you don't see too many overweight people in Seattle! Russell, the concierge, couldn't be more helpful and the tall bell hop is great to watch calling you a cab. Great bar, good beer and good ambiance with good looking staff who couldn't be more helpful. Would I stay there again? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaxncjax
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice hotel. Rooms were very clean and hotel was quiet despite being right downtown. Very convenient location due to close proximity to popular markets and shopping areas. The best part was the Library Bistro which is the adjoining hotel restaurant. Our group ate breakfast there every day and we all agreed the food was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Solochicky
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through my husband's corporate rate so take what I say in light of the $170 some odd dollars a night we paid. We requested a non-smoking king room. The room we got, although spacious, was not a king - not even close. In fact, we think it was a large double. A very comfortable bed though with great pillows. The huge flat screen tv was great, although we didn't watch a whole lot of tv. Big closet and a nice bathroom. Located right off the waterfront, in between Pike Place and Pioneer Square so you can't beat the locaton. We were told at check-in that wi-fi was free, not that we could take advantage of it because we left the lap top at home. The price to use the business center was high in my opinion - $5.95 for 15 minutes. On our last day there, we didn't feel like walking up the hill to Nordstroms so we asked the front desk what bus we could take to the shopping area. I'm not sure if they were listening because the bus they sent us on did not take us anywhere close to our intended destination. Really nice hotel overall and it will make me consider other Kimpton hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What a great room!”
Reviews.Author: blk47rs
Reviews.Content: God help me, I love nice hotels! So much so, that after I book a room at a good hotel, I frequently find myself getting over-excited while I anticipate my journey. By the time I arrive, my expectations are often so high that even a great room loses some of its luster. That's why I found the Alexis to be so great. Despite my high expectations, the room far surpassed them! We had a double queen room. The near ceiling high windows filled the spacious room with light! (yes, the sun does shine in Seattle) My bed was as comfortable as any I've ever slept in! The room was beautifully appointed! And, surprisingly, (since it wasn't mentioned in the on-line room description) it even had a fully equipped kitchen! Full size refrigerator, flat top range, microwave, dishwasher, toaster, full table service, knife set, fry pans, baking dishes, cake pans, tea kettle, pasta strainer.... Being so conveniently located just blocks from Pike Place Market means that everything you need to cook your own meals is at your fingertips. Of course, with all the great restaurants in Seattle, you may not want to but the option is there! The staff was helpful and congenial and I found none of the problems that a few of the posters have mentioned. We stayed just three nights before departing on a cruise. While the cruise was great, I found myself wishing I'd spent less of my vacation on the ship and more in Seattle, in large part, due to this lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DSSenn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married on July 19 in Jacksonville, Florida and arrived on July 20 at the Alexis Hotel. We were greeted by a wonderful front desk staff who helped us get checked in and gave us a quick overview of the hotel and the amenities at the hotel. We stayed in the Honeymoon Suite, and when we got to the room we were blown away. The room is very spacious and features awesome photography and paintings throughout. Even the lamps in the room are works of art. The feel of the room is modern and trendy meets vintage charm. The bed is very comfortable and has curtains around it. The bathroom features a giant garden-style tub and a dual-head shower. There is a view of Elliott Bay, Puget Sound, and the Olympic Mountains out the window. Pike Place Market is just a short walk away, and the waterfront is just a few blocks away. We visited the on-site Library Bistro for breakfast one day and lunch another, and it was great both times. Maid service was wonderful; everything was always neat and tidy when we arrived back at the hotel after a day out. It is a little expensive to park your car because it is valet only, but it is so worth it to be able to call down to the front desk a few minutes before you want to leave and have your car waiting for you when you get downstairs. The valets are very helpful with directions and recommendations on places to visit. All in all, I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone who loves art and is looking for a classy place to stay without any pretentiousness.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Wedding Night!”
Reviews.Author: SEAWAEASTLAKE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alexis Hotel the night before my wedding and the night of my wedding in the Honeymoon Suite. It was the perfect place to get ready for the big day with my bridesmaids. The staff took excellent care of every need we had (which was plenty due to 7 ladies getting ready!). The room was immaculate when my husband and I arrived after the wedding. We had a lovely experience and would highly recommend the Alexis Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed ever”
Reviews.Author: trippin76
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel Alexis! My boyfriend ad I stayed here two nights in June and loved everything about it. Upon check-in the staff was very friendly, got us into our room early and gave us a walking map of downtown. The room (king bed) was small but nicely decorated and comfortable. The bed was the best! SO comfortable.We just melted into it. I wanted to take it with us when we left. The bathroom was large and stylish. Enjoyed the Aveda products. The location of this hotel is great too. Walking distance from Pike Place Market (about 3-4 blocks) and right on a bus route if you want to go further away. Busses are free in downtown Seattle. I would stay at the Alexis again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Love To Just Move In!!!”
Reviews.Author: ORStarr
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from an incredible three night stay at the Alexis Hotel. We had a fabulous time! The staff at the Alexis were wonderful. We arrived 2 hours prior to check in and were met at the bottom of the stairs by a hostess from the Library Bistro who carried our suitcase up the stairs and stored it for us while we had lunch in the Bistro. Lunch at the Bistro was wonderful, our waiter was great (we had him both days we ate at the Bistro) and the bistro is a lovely relaxing place to eat. The steak was perfectly cooked and the profiteroles were amazing! The Front Desk staff checked us in early and they gave us the higher floor room I had requested. I had booked a Deluxe King but I suspect we were upgraded as our room was really rooms. We had a huge living room and dining room area with a couch and 3 chairs and a large flat screen TV. It was a corner room with window with huge windows overlooking downtown on two walls. We could even seen the harbor from our room. The view at night was beautiful. The rooms were gorgeous! I would have loved to have taken our floor lamp home. As a plus both the couch and the chairs were comfortable as well as being beautiful. The computer desk was great! Easy access for charger plug in and plenty of desk space. We had a HUGE dining room table which came in handy for our room service orders. Speaking of the room service it was wonderful. They are fast and friendly and the food options are yummy, even when you are calling them at 1 in the morning. It was really nice to be able to have an all night menu to choose from if you get in late and the butternut squash soup is wonderful! Our bathroom was gorgeous and had a wonderful rain shower and a nice long tub that you can get comfy in. Our separate bedroom had two huge windows with a gorgeous view. The bed was TO DIE FOR and worth checking into just to sleep in it or lounge around and watch our flat screen TV. Also the rooms had heavy silk curtains that totally blocked out light and made it so very easy to sleep in! The location of the hotel is great for a tourist visit. You are right by the waterfront with the boat tours and the pier shops as well as within walking distance of Pike's Place Market and Pioneer Square. Note to those who don't love to walk, if you take Spring St downhill to the waterfront you can walk to Pike on flat land. If you stay on 1st you will have a hill. If you do walk the hilly way go to Piroshky Piroshky in Pikes and reward yourself with baked good guilt free ;) The doormen were helpful as well for those times when we were too lazy to walk and wanted a cab and the concierge services we helpful with getting us bus information. I am completely sold on The Alexis and will never stay anywhere else when in Seattle and will recommend them to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: WarmVacations
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and found the location easy to get to and leave for the airport. Room was well appointed, with large windows facing an office building 50 feet away... but the curtains worked. My room was fairly small, while others in my group had huge rooms. I did not give this hotel a higher mark because of those differences and the very expensive food was just that.. expensive and average. We walked down the street, 2 blocks, and found a ton of GREAT restaurants right on the wharf. I also used the spa, which is independent, and attached to the hotel. I was able to charge to the room. The massusse was awful, so make sure you ask about how "he" will do your massage. The perfume shop would not let me charge to my room because the hotel pays very slowly. I would come back, but request the larger rooms. It is trying to be a very special place, but hasn't gotten their yet. I will say the staff are very very friendly, and helpful. But I get that now in holiday inns now as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TopTownUSA
Reviews.Content: The Alexis is in a wonderful location. Close to anything you would possibly want to do in downtown Seattle. Just a few blocks from the water front, pioneer square and pikes place market. The space needle and big shopping areas are a tad bit farther of a walk but absolutely doable. The front door staff was very helpful when asked for directions or opinions on activities and always greeted us as we came and went. They were very quick to call a taxi for you and were just all around great people. The hotel was very clean and quiet. The only noise we heard was one early morning some pounding in the streets from some kind of construction. It was not related to the hotel or the hotels fault. We drove from Kansas (26 hours) so I really wanted to have a massage in our room but wasn't able to locate anyone who had any idea who I needed to contact in order to schedule one. It was listed on the room service menu so I know they existed. The attached salon is apparently not the correct place if you would like a massage in your room. I would have settled for one at the salon but they were completely booked for our entire stay. Oh well, it wasn't too big of a deal. I have only two small complaints. Room service is VERY expensive. All the delivery fee/service fee on top of the meal prices you will easily drop well over 50 bucks for a small meal/snack. However the food was very good and fairly timely. One night we ordered cookies and milk for a small dessert. The hotel didnâ€™t have any baked but said they were putting them in right away and would bring them as soon as they were done. We called about 15 minutes before it was time for room service to shut down for the night. About 45 minutes to an hour later they finally showed up with them. They were very apologetic and gave us a few extra cookies and didnâ€™t charge us at all for them because they took so long. Not only did they not charge us, but they even stayed late to bake them and deliver them to us. To me that is great service. They didnâ€™t wait for us to complain about the long wait, they were proactive in the situation and made sure we were happy. We wouldnâ€™t have complained anyway because we are very laid back people but the fact that they went out of their way to do that for us was very personal and heartfelt. The other complaint is when we were leaving we called ahead for our car to be retrieved. We waited the 10 minutes like instructed and then lugged our suitcases to the lobby. No one had any idea who was supposed to have gotten our car. We waited another 10 to 15 minutes for someone the find out who should be getting our car. Like I said these are very small nitpicky thing that happened on an overall wonderful trip. We will definitely stay there again if we should ever go to Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: the-traveling-gal
Reviews.Content: WOW! What a fantastic stay. This hotel is perfectly located, we walked almost everywhere from there. The rooms are spacious and decorated beautifully. I was offered and accepted an upgrade and had a fabulous suite for my stay. My whole family stayed there before a cruise and each of the 5 or 6 rooms were decorated differently and shaped differently, really a cool place to stay. The front desk was warm and welcoming also. The food in the restaurant, on property, was wonderful and the bar in the front of the building, what a great little find. We all met up there upon arrival. It was great and seems to be enjoyed by people from the area also. All around great find and will definitely stay there on my next visit~!

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love”
Reviews.Author: BethanyB26
Reviews.Content: All I can say is FABULOUS!! I stay in at least 6 hotels a month and when in Seattle I will never stay anywhere except the ALEXIS from now on. From the outside it doesn't look like much but the inside is GORGEOUS!! From the moment we entered we were treated like royalty..at some higher end hotels the staff have attitudes but NOT here. We stayed in the Alexis 1 bedroom suite and it took our breath away. It was HUGE and super modern. From the exposed brick wall and sky light to the huge living and dining area, not to mention the sexy bedroom it just ooozed class. Some others have complained in their reviews about paying 30$ for valet but if you have ever tried to find parking in a safe place on 1st avenue in Seattle it is worth every penny to have your vehicle taken care of in a safe secure area. If you are considering staying here DO IT!! you will not regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Cleaning fee not cool...”
Reviews.Author: da32528
Reviews.Content: There is a cleaning fee if you smoke in your room.. the fee is $250.00, the hotel has mis-understood a recent law in Washington state banning smoking. The law does NOT apply to hotel room's and a $250.00 cleaning fee is rediculous. All hotel's should accomodate ALL guest type's and not be in the UN-hospitality business but the hospitality industry.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Franklina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexis Hotel in mid-May and found it to have a great location as well as being very clean and updated. The hotel is about a ten minute walk from Pikes in one direction and 5 minutes from Pioneer Square in the opposite direction. Our room was very big on the fourth floor with two queen size beds. We would definitely stay at this Kimpton property again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Wonderful Hotel and Experience”
Reviews.Author: SpicynShellie
Reviews.Content: The Alexis is a magnificent jewel in the West Edge neighborhood of Seattle. Beautifully appointed with eclectic and unique art and furnishings thoughout. Front Desk and Bell Staff absolutely helpful and friendly. Room was beautifully decorated with modern art and 5 amazingly different lamps, plasma screen TV, and 3 large windows that opened wide to bring in the gorgeous city air. The bed was a dream to sleep on. Lovely cotton sheets and extremely comfortable mattress. Bathroom chock full of Aveda products, plentiful luxurious linens, phenomenal shower head with good flow. Love the robes that are available for purchase. Only 2 blocks to waterfront and 6 blocks to Pine Street (the Retail Core) and Pikes Market. The # 18 bus runs on First Avenue where the Alexis is located and is free in the downtown area. If you take the #56 bus just south of Madison and First you can get out to Alki Beach for just $3.50 round trip. McCormick and Schmicks Seafood Restaurant is the best for seafood and you can sign to your room at the Alexis. Restaurant is half block north of the hotel. Complimentary coffee in the lobby is excellent as is the complimentary evening wine tasting. Be sure to put an Early Housekeeping sign on your room door if you plan to return to your room midday otherwise you may wait for your room to be cleaned. Housekeeping Staff was flawless and paid attention to every detail. Stacks of New York Times, Seattle Times. and The Wall Street Journal are available for free in the lobby. I enjoyed jumping out of bed, grabbing a cup of coffee downstairs and bring the papers back to my room. A complimentary Seattle Times paper is delivered to your room daily. If you need quiet during the day and want to keep your windows opened, I would suggest asking for a room away from the front of First Avenue. That being said, I enjoyed my room facing First Avenue and the noise didn't bother me but I was not conducting business on this trip. Pet friendly, no hidden charges, makes this hotel the #1 pick in Seattle for me. I plan to frequent Kimpton when I can because of their strong committment to the environment and giving back to the community. What amazed and delighted me was that each room had a recycling container and a trash can. This is unprecedented in the mega corporate hotels that I normally frequent. Alexis and staff, you truly wowed me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Perfect Staff”
Reviews.Author: nycgeorgian
Reviews.Content: Best of the Best First Class All the Way My friend and I stayed at this lovely hotel for 4 nights. First, the staff is wonderful. Our reservation got mixed up, but Drew quickly fixed the problem. And, did it with the flourish of a Hotelier of old. Perfect. He also made wonderful dinner and tourist suggestions. The other members of the front desk staff, Sophie was one, were friendly, professional, informed and just very pleasant. The room was lovely, and had a comfortable feel. Room service was delicious. There was not a request made that wasn't taken care of quickly and courteously. Better than courteous -- with a friendship, like we were visiting relatives. Didn't want to leave and look forward to returning on our next trip to Seattle. We travel 40 - 50 nights a year, the Alexis was a high spot. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute BEST hotel I've Ever Been too!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandria91910
Reviews.Content: The Alexis Hotel was by far one of the best, most excellent hotels that I have been to my whole life. The service was great, the food was fantastic, and the room had the warm feeling of home plus more. If I had to reccomend any hotel in the US, of course it would be the Alexis.

Reviews.Title: “All we coud say was WOW!”
Reviews.Author: pcmpapacherry
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have recently taken on the task of grooming the city of Seattle to find a hotel that we would stay at more than once, and for more than one reason. Let me tell you, this one is it! We started out our experience being promptly and courteously greeted by a very helpful and friendly Valet team who unloaded our car and pushed our luggage into the lobby. The woman at the front desk was then very kind, and got us checked in almost immediately. We continued on to our room which was beautiful, well lit, and very clean. The decor in our room was very inviting and top notch, as far as I am concerned. Now, on to the bed. Wow. It was so comfortable that we didn't want to leave in the morning. I remember saying, "What time do we have to check out?". We didn't want to get up. So, I can definitely recommend The Alexis Hotel to anyone with confidence. The only cons to this hotel: Valet is a little pricey at around $30+ a night, the lobby air is a tad stale, and our shower water went a little hot here and there. Other than that, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: devonbrooke
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we have stayed at a Kimpton Hotel, and it definitely won't be the last. We have stayed in at least 10 different hotels in Seattle over the years, and this was our best experience ever! First of all, the staff was excellent, starting with the very pleasant young lady who took our booking, and continuing throughout our stay. I had made a request asking for as large a room as possible at our price point, as we were 3 adults sharing a room, and that request was granted. In fact, we joked that our room was roomier than what we were used to in our homes. I had also mentioned that we were in Seattle to celebrate my friend's "milestone" birthday, and were very pleased to find a complmentary bottle of wine, and chocolates (!), with a nice note from the hotel in our room. We attended the courtesy wine get-together, and it was a very pleasant and friendly event. In fact, just prior to the event, we had run into a friend who was staying at another hotel, and when I asked at the front desk if he could join us, the answer was "of course!". I understand that the hotel has just undergone an extensive renovation - it was lovely, and both the lobby and our room were very nicely appointed. There is a lot of impressive art displayed everywhere. The Alexis feels very upscale, but warm at the same time - we felt very welcomed there. We were very impressed! We only stayed one night, but we wished it could have been for longer. We can hardly wait to go back. Kudo's to everyone at the Alexis Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Alexis Hotel Heaven on First Avenue in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: juliebug52
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the other 2 Kimpton Hotels in Seattle and the Alexis will be my first choice from now on. What we loved: Free internet. Coffee service in the room. The location. The pleasant helpful staff. The complimentary wine and beer social in the Library Bistro Bar. Ipod docking station in the room. Flat screen tv. The art in the hotel. So classy. The decorator's intention was to show what an artist's home would look like. Our room had seven lamps and none of them matched. None of the end tables or desk or tables matched but they all "worked together". We were upgraded to a spa suite. They bathroom was gorgeous with black marble floors, marble counter tops and the deepest jacuzzi tub I have seen! There was a large mirror over the tub, a nice bench in the tiled bathroom and even a bronze sculpture in the huge bathroom. My husband's only complaint was that it was a long walk to the bathroom. We slept very well here. Stay here...you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: grimkitty1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexis hotel which is in the center of downtown Seattle. We booked a spa suite which was nice but weird. From what we gathered speaking to the other visitors all of the rooms were a bit strange. For instance the bathroom was HUGE, at least 40% of the sq room footage. It had a large bathtub with spa jets and a separate shower way across the bathroom.Our windows looked directly into the next building which were offices. There was a door which lead down a flight of stairs to a closet and another locked door presumably to the suite below. It was scary to think the people below us could walk up the stairs and try to open the door to our room(which was right next to the bed).
